description:
SMS presents the Unilever Internship Information Session.

Where? 
Eastern Avenue Lecture Theatre (Level 3 above Eastern Avenue Auditorium)

When? 
Tuesday, 4th August, 3-4 pm

Why?
This is an exclusive opportunity to gain first hand information about Unilever's prestigious Internship Program. It's the No. 1 FMCG Internship Program in Australia.

You'll get to meet Unilever graduate staff and have all your questions answered. This is a great opportunity to expand your networks and open up new career opportunities! 

Free food will also be provided.

Want to find out more about Unilever's Internship Program?

There are openings in the following business areas:                -- Customer Development
-- Marketing 
-- Finance
-- Supply Chain

Alright, Alright, Alright. 

Time for a General Meeting or as the young people are calling it, a GM. 

Basically we will make the necessary constitutional changes to comply with the USU. BUT, we will also be looking to discuss SMS' plan for the rest of the Semester (a workshop, a panel?) - so it would be fantastic to join us and have a say in what you would like to see. 

We also plan to have food and drinks so your tummy won't have a say during the meeting as well. #corn1001 joke. 

If you have any enquiries regarding the GM or SMS related insights in general contact: Amy Patterson, Marc Onus or Kai Ming Romberg-Yee!

See you there.

description:
Guess what SMSers?

We have teamed up with GradConnection to launch the Top100 Most Employable Future Graduates Competition!!

Stand out from the crowd in 1 of 5 categories including MARKETING, Business & Commerce, Accounting & Finance, Information Technology or Engineering!

Not convinced?

Well here’s 4 more great reasons why you should enter:

1. Official Top100 Finalist Listing – Your profile will be featured on the GradConnection.com Awards Page… i.e. you will be famous!

2. Awards Night - The top 5 students in each category gets to attend an exclusive awards dinner with Australia’s leading employers, where the winner and runners up in each category will be announced

3. Widely Recognised Badge – Official recognition that you can use on your CV when applying for a graduate position

4. You will hear about opportunities before anyone else as GradConnection will share your name with employers!

Interested? Sign up here using this special link -> http://au.gradconnection.com/sms-top100/

All students from any year level are encouraged to apply.

Remember the competition closes on Tuesday 30th of September so get onto it NOW!

Yours,
SMS Executive Team

description:

The SMS Careers Fair is our most popular event of the year, last semester 200+ students from Universities across Sydney came through, to network with industry representatives and ask their careers questions. The SMS Careers Fair is the only marketing specific careers fair at University.

event_name: Sydney Marketing Society Annual General Meeting
description:
Annual General Meeting to elect a new Executive Team. 

To nominate yourself for a role(s), please email James Fan (jamesfan1@gmail.com) by 5 pm Wednesday the 3rd of September with your name, University of Sydney Access Number, and a short paragraph on why you are a good fit for these roles.

Venue is the Holme Common Room (http://lostoncampus.com.au/8550)

Note that only Access Members are allowed to nominate themselves and vote according to University of Sydney Union regulations 

Agenda of an Annual General Meeting of Sydney Marketing Society

To be held at 4 PM on 5 September 2013

In the Holme Common Room

1. Opening and Welcome

2. Apologies and Leaves of Absence

3. Minutes of the Previous Meeting

4. Business Arising from the Minutes

5. Correspondence

6. Motions on Notice

7. Annual Reports

8. Election of the Executives

The following positions are up for election

President
Vice President
Treasurer
Secretary
Careers & Sponsorships Executive (2)
Marketing Executive (2)
Socials Executive (1)
IT Executive (1)

9. General Business

10. Other Business

11. Date of the Next Meeting

12. Close of Meeting

Get your glitz and glamour on, because the stars are coming out at EDSOC's 2017 Starry Night Ball! You're living, you occupy space, you have mass. You know what that means? ... YOU MATTER! Come feel like a superstar with EDSOC and have a great time which we've all been STAR-ving for! This event is out of this world, end your semester with a big bang and give yourself a gold star with a ticket to EDSOC ball!!

Bigger and better than ever, we are here to host the best ball of the 2017! Treat yourself to a delicious three course dinner, 4.5 hour beverage package, photo booth and prizes to win! It's the perfect way to end the year and celebrate uni with your friends! You've got to GOGH to the ball ;)

When: 27th of October, 2017
Time: 7:00pm
Where: Dockside, CockleBay Wharf Rooms, Darling Harbour 
Price: Access $100// Non Access $105

PURCHASE TICKETS TODAY : https://events.ticketbooth.com.au/event/edsoc-ball-2017---starry-night

What's Included:
- Three course sit down dinner (dietary requirements/allergies will be catered to) 
- 4.5 hour unlimited drinks package 
- Fun photobooth with props
- Fun prizes to give away

description:
Promising to be the biggest and by far the best Interfac event of the year, Week 11 brings us the 5km run! The perfect way to get active, catch up with friends, work off that excess uni stress and earn that extra beer at Manning Bar - this is the event for you. 

No running necessary, you can literally stroll your way around the course - all skill levels are welcome! As long as you cross that start and finish line you earn a point for the team! 

And if that doesn't take your fancy there is also a FREE BBQ - you heard it, all snags for FREE! Now if that still isn't your calling - there will be post run drinks at Manning Bar - who can decline that offer. 
___________________________________________________
FORMAT: 5km Course around USYD Campus (2 laps of course)
TIME: Arrive at 2pm to sign in/get a wrist band. 2.30pm start 
LOCATION: The Grandstand, Oval No.1 behind Ralphs
UNIFORM: Anything purple

1 PARTICIPANT = 1 POINT. 
1 FACULTY VOLUNTEER = 2 POINTS. 
This event is the best way of boosting out points (especially via volunteers) so grab a mate or 10 and join the fun. 
___________________________________________________
If you have any questions or are keen to participate/volunteer please click attending on this event and contact Emma Gavaghan or Kasumi Higewake ASAP.

Male and female placings. 
1st = 10pts
2nd = 7pts
3rd = 5pts
4th = 3pts

CALLOUT FOR DRYLIGHT SUBMISSIONS 2017!!!

Drylight is EDSOC’s annual publication showcasing work from both staff and students within the Sydney School of Education and Social Work. 

We are looking for articles, creative pieces, essays and reviews to include in our 2017 publication.

Categories for this year include:
- Current issues or debates in education or social work
- Educational theory
- Social work
- Gender and sexuality
- Mental health
- Indigenous issues
- Overseas experiences
- Professional experiences
- Reviews of events and initiatives of EDSOC and the School
- Rural experiences
- Faculty merger
- Sport and physical education
- Youth culture
- Teaching in popular culture

If you have written something that falls under any of these categories (or plan to write something over the break), we strongly encourage you to submit your work to be published in Drylight 2017. This is your chance to write alongside academics and become a published author in one of the university’s oldest and most prestigious student publications. 

Please email all submissions to Raashna at publications@edsoc.org.au by 11:59pm on 18 August 2017.

Submissions are open to all students and staff within the Sydney School of Education and Social Work. (If you are not within our school, you are still encouraged to apply). 

To see what we're all about, check out our past editions at http://www.edsoc.org.au/publications/

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GUIDELINES:

Submissions should be no more than 3,500 words in length.

Creative pieces may take the form of a short story, poem, photo essay or visual artwork. 

Please submit written pieces as a Word document.

Please submit visual pieces as an image file, with a short explanation of its relevance/significance to the publication.

PLEASE REMEMBER TO INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING WITH YOUR SUBMISSION – your name, your degree and year level, unit of study name and code (if submitting work from a unit of study), and a title for your work. 

If you have any further questions, please email Raashna at publications@edsoc.org.au

event_name: EDSOC First Year Camp 2017 - Where the Wild Things Are
description:
Howdy to all you rowdy EDSOC firsties!!!!

YOU are invited to come along to one of EDSOCs best social events ever. You only get to be a first year once so this is the experience you definitely don’t want to miss out on. 

The EDSOC team has created a weekend away for you to meet the people you will be spending the next 4-5 years with. As a society we’re here to make the transition into the broke uni student life as smooth and as effortless as possible. What better way to do so than by being forced to bunk with complete strangers for 2 nights right? We’ve planned plenty of bonding experiences for you throughout the weekend all to be capped off with a friendship confirming party on the last night. This year the theme is "Where the Wild Things Are". 

Transportation will be provided to and from the camp. 

Alcohol will be provided* and in copious amounts so please don't BYO. Just bring yourselves plz. 

Ticket prices are as follows:
EDSOC Members**:$105
Access: 			$110
Non Access: 		$115

Online payments can be made using this link http://www.edsoc.org.au/first-year-camp-2017/ . Online tickets are dropping Week 1 Day 1 Monday @ 10am. Cash payments can be made at the EDSOC office (Education Building Room 406) Tuesdays and Thursdays from  1 - 4pm. There are limited spots so you have to get in quick. 

Watch this space for further info (an itinerary is coming soon)! Post here in the event page or email me (Annie) at events@edsoc.org.au if you have any questions (or would like to buy a cash ticket outside of office hours)!!

*The USU and EDSOC support and promote the responsible service of alcohol
**Membership is $5

Note: This event is for first year students studying in the School of Education and Social Work at USYD

EDSOC will be hosting our Semester 1 Cardie Crawl on Friday 24th March around Newtown! (Right after our AGM)! YES FRIDAY! No midweek hang overs like last year! You can meet fellow students, bring your friends, or make new ones.

6:00pm - COURTHOUSE
7:30pm - WEBSTERS
9:00pm - NEWTOWN HOTEL
10.30 - TOKYO SING SONG

Kicking off at 6pm for the first round of free drinks/nibbles at our beloved Courty (The Courthouse for y'all non-locals) so make sure you're there to get into the broke uni student spirit. Next venue is the lovely rooftop of Websters at 7:30pm. Get your cocktails on and fancy drinks under the stars. Then at 9pm, we get the party going with some dancing and shots at the Newtown Hotel, before rounding out the night with terrifying Karaoke and lots more dancing at Tokyo Sing Song. 

Semester 1 Crawl was CRAYYYY with our fav lecturers breakin it down on the DF. Let's see if we can get them on top of the bar this time.

event_name: SOLD OUT - Seven Deadly Sins: EDSOC Ball 2016
description:
This year the society is embracing its DARK side. We’ve been teachers pets all semester and now it's time to let out our Deadly Sins at the end of year Ball. Gluttony and Greed as we finish our 3 course meals. Lust and Pride as we take over the dance floor. Envy and Wrath as we compare outfits. And a very lazy Sloth morning the next day.

This year EDSOC will be hosting our end of year ball at the infamous Dockside Pavilion on the water of Darling Harbour. With the past three year sold out, this years venue is bigger and better than all others before!  Worship yourself with a sumptuous three course dinner as well as a 4.5 hour beverage package, photo booth and prizes to win! What a perfect way to end the year and celebrate with your uni friends

Time:  7.00
Where: Dockside Pavilion (on the water), Darling Harbour
Price: Access $95 // Non Access $100

Purchase your ticket now from : http://www.edsoc.org.au/edsoc-ball-2016/

(All dietary and allergy requirements can be accommodated and are required when purchasing)

EDSOC, in conjunction with The University of Sydney - Staff Wellbeing Committee, is excited to announce an upcoming talk/Q&A session on the SAFE SCHOOL PROJECT and issues for students, staff, and the wider community around this important initiative. The afternoon intends to raise awareness of the program and to look at strategies to support LGBTI young people in schools/universities.

WHO: Ms Mary Flaskas, Project Officer from the Safe School Coalition NSW

WHAT:  Lecture and Q&A Session  about the Safe School program 

WHERE:  Lecture Theatre 351, Education Building (A35), Faculty of Education and Social Work

WHEN:  Monday, 10th October 2016,  4~5:30 p.m.

The talk will be followed by an afternoon tea in room 401 from 5:30-6 in the Staff Common Room (Rm 401) and an opportunity for one-on-one chats. 
 
For more information on the coalition, please go to http://www.safeschoolscoalition.org.au.   
 
To ensure adequate catering, please RSVP Kim at kimberly.hammond@sydney.edu.au if you will be in attendance.
 
Sponsored by the Staff Well Being Group, Faculty of Education and Social Work.

CALLOUT FOR SUBMISSIONS, DRYLIGHT 2016!!!

First published in 1935, Drylight is EDSOC’s annual publication showcasing work from both staff and students within the Faculty of Education and Social Work here at USyd. We collect and publish student works, academic research, creative pieces and reviews of the many initiatives and events of the Faculty and the Society throughout the year. 

We are looking for articles, creative pieces, essays and reviews from students and staff within the Faculty to include in our 2016 publication!

Categories for this year include:
-	Current issues or debates in education or social work
-	Educational theory
-       Faculty merger
-	Gender and sexuality
-	Indigenous issues
-	Overseas experiences
-	Professional experiences
-	Reviews of events and initiatives of EDSOC and the Faculty
-	Rural experiences
-	Social work
-	Sport and physical education
-	Youth culture

If you have written something that falls under any of these categories (or plan to write something over the break), we strongly encourage you to submit your work to be published in Drylight 2016. This is essentially your chance to write alongside academics and become a published author in one of the university’s oldest and most prestigious student publications! How cool is that?! 

Please email all submissions to Genevieve at publications@edsoc.org.au by 11:59pm on 21 August 2016.

Submissions are open to all students and staff within the Faculty of Education and Social Work.

To see what we're all about, check out our past editions at http://www.edsoc.org.au/publications/

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

GUIDELINES:

Submissions should be no more than 3,500 words in length.

Creative pieces may take the form of a short story, poem, photo essay or visual artwork. 

Please submit written pieces as a Word document.

Please submit visual pieces as an image file, with a short explanation of its relevance/significance to the publication.

PLEASE REMEMBER TO INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING WITH YOUR SUBMISSION – your name, your degree and year level, unit of study name and code (if submitting work from a unit of study), and a title for your work. 

If you have any further questions, please email Genevieve at publications@edsoc.org.au

description:
Social Work Connect USyd: ALUMNI EDITION

+Meet +Share +Inspire

Social Work Connect is a professional development opportunity, in a similar vein to Ted Talks, with 5 minute presentations by Social Work graduates from USYD. #USYDSWC aims to impart tips, tricks, insights and wisdom for our future social workers. Free to attend. Open to all students, academics and practising social workers-- or anyone with an interest in equity and social justice! Light refreshments drinks and nibbles will be provided during intermission.

This semester, EDSOC has a stellar line up of USYD alumni who are returning to share their wisdom, experiences and lessons that they have learnt upon entering the social work profession. If you are a USYD alumnus/alumna and would like to present at future Social Work Connects, please contact anthony.gee@sydney.edu.au

For those wishing to attend, please sign up at https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/usyd-social-work-meet-tickets-26748175513

Join the conversation and get excited with #USYDSWC on Monday 8/8/16 from 5-7pm at the History Room S223 in the USYD Quadrangle.

Following the Social Work Connect, all guests are invited to "SocialWorkEat" at Courtyard Café, on us!
place: History Room S223, Quadrangle, University of Sydney

Calling all budding teachers, educators, social workers or anyone involved in Education/Social Work - 

This semester has been an uphill battle for the EDSOC faculty but we have a chance to retake our rightful position as the most athletic faculty. Let's show Law what we have got! Come down and represent EDSOC in the 3km run this Wednesday Week 12. It is the last competition of the semester and promises to be the biggest!

I have it on good authority that Steve Georgakis and Remy Low have cracked open their piggy banks and will be shouting jugs at  Manning post race to help you rehydrate. And if that doesn't take your fancy there is also a FREE BBQ - you heard it, all snags for FREE!

INVITE ALL EDUCATION STUDENTS/FRIENDS/STAFF

Rules: 
1. Register on the Education roll upon arrival at the event. 

2. 1 PARTICIPANT = 1 POINT. 
You must follow the route and finish the race to receive a point for the team. You can literally hovel across the line, the more people we have complete the race the more points we will get!

3. FACULTY VOLUNTEER = 2 POINTS. Each team must provide minimum 2 marshals + 2 volunteers to help run the event BUT the more the better. This is where we got those extra points - so if you like to drink beer and stand around, this is your calling! 

If you're keen to run/walk/crawl or volunteer please click attending on this event and contact Emma Gavaghan ASAP. 

Any questions/concerns make a post on this event or contact Emma. 

Placings:
Male and female placings. 
1st = 10pts
2nd = 7pts
3rd = 5pts
4th = 3pts

This is sure to be an awesome event so come down and get around Education and have a dash for the best faculty on campus! 

Get down to Sydney Uni Oval No.1 at 2pm for a 2:30pm start!

description:
Soccer Football Grassroots Certificate, Skills Training Certificate and Futsal Certificate

These are 3 hour certified football courses that are fully practical and encourage you to develop teaching practices that are based on FUN. The emphasis is on natural development i.e. learning by PLAYING football. No coaching but organising FUN football exercises is the key to helping players build a love for the game. Another highlight of the course is that the coaches are exposed to basic rules of the game as well as tips and hints on building a football culture in a completely practical setting.
This qualification will look great on your portfolio, but it also demonstrates that you have a commitment to advance yourself and your knowledge as a professional.

Participants need to register through the links below. 

Grassroots Football Certificate – 21 April – 8AM
https://education-ffa.sportingpulse.com/event.asp?ID=14286

+Meet +Share +Inspire

#TMUSyd aims to impart tips, tricks, insights and wisdom for teachers and pre-service teachers. Free to attend. Open to all students, academics and practising teachers-- or anyone with an interest in teaching and education! Light refreshments drinks and nibbles will be provided. 

This semester, we have a stellar line up of USYD alumni who are returning to share their wisdom. If you are a USYD alumnus/alumna and would like to present, please contact anthony.gee@sydney.edu.au

For those wishing to attend, please sign up at the link above. 

Join the conversation and get excited with #TMUSyd on Wednesday 13/4/16 from 4-6pm at the History Room S223 in the USYD Quadrangle.

Following the TeachMeet, all guests are invited to "TeachEat" at Courtyard Café, on us!
place: University of Sydney Quad History Room S223

description:

6:00pm - COURTHOUSE
7:30pm - ZANZIBAR
9:00pm - NEWTOWN HOTEL

Then at 9pm, we get the party going with some dancing and shots at the Newtown Hotel, before rounding out the night with terrifying Karaoke and lots more dancing at Tokyo Sing Song.

event_name: EDSOC First Ever ALL Years Camp
description:
CALLING ALL EDUCATION AND SOCIAL WORK STUDENTS!! We want you at EDSOC’s inaugural ALL year camp!

It’s that time of year where you awkwardly try and fail to make new friends in your eduf tutes. #lolmemz
well dw cos we got chu fam.

The EDSOC exec team has put together a weekend of bonding and friendship making. There will be trivia, a high ropes activity, a waterslide and of course a party night to seal the deal of comradeship. We will be providing all the food and drinks for the weekend (yes this includes alcohol, duh).
What to bring: 
- yourselves
- a hella sik attitude 
- swimmers (for the waterslide ;) ) 
An extended itinerary and further deets will be provided closer to the date :))
Spots are limited so first in, first serve. Follow this link to purchase your tickets: http://www.edsoc.org.au/first-year-camp-2016/ 

Tickets: 
$110 for Access Members 
$115 for Non - Access Members 

Please Note = EDSOC and USU promotes the responsible service of alcohol and no BYO alcohol will be allowed. This is an 18+ event with photo identification and indemnity forms to be filled out before approval.

!!!!!! WE ARE NOW OFFICIALLY SOLD OUT OF TICKETS !!!!!!!
This year, the society embraces the grand party traditions of The Great Gatsby! So cue the flappers, feathers, pearls, bow-ties, and vintage jazz music!! This will be a night of class, fun and mischief. Here are the details:
When: Friday 30th October, 2015
Time: 7pm-midnight, please arrive at 6:45pm
Where: Dockside, Balcony Level, Cockle Bay Wharf 
Price: ACCESS $80 or NON-ACCESS $85.00
What’s Included:
      • Three course sit down dinner
      • 4.5 hour unlimited drinks package
      • DJ and dancefloor to get the party started
      • Photo booth fun and props
      • Awards and prizes to give away

Tickets for this event is now SOLD OUT. Desperately want one still? Well we don’t have any more, but you can put your name on a waiting list and hopefully *fingers crossed* someone can contact you to sell directly. Don’t forget to have the original purchaser email any updated details for you (i.e. seating arrangement and dietary requirements). EDSOC Ball 2015: Waiting List Form = http://goo.gl/forms/bOqsXSDW7l

EDSOC will do our best to organise seating arrangements by a first come, first serve basis. Also, attendees who purchase their tickets in the one transaction will have automatic preference to be seated together, unless otherwise requested or unless no tables are left for the group size. 

Choose songs you want to hear by adding it to our Spotify Playlist: https://open.spotify.com/user/1253625772/playlist/6ccyaDzFn171P7gU8bUXNU

For more information and to sign-up visit: http://www.edsoc.org.au/teachmeet-usyd-2015/

description:
Tickets AVAILABLE TO BE BOOKED ON MONDAY 28th APRIL 2014

It's that time of the year again! The Education and Social Work Society will be hosting its famous End of Semester Cruise on Friday 6th of June (this is the last teaching day of semester 1, and the last day of practicum for 4th Year B.Ed (Secondary)!

The result of our poll to pick a theme saw an overwhelming response for 'Talk Nerdy to Me: High School Stereotypes', so come as a nerd, come as a jock, come as any school stereotype you like!

Where: King Street Wharf
When: Friday 6th June, 2014
Time: 7:00pm (Markoff) 7:30pm (Departure)
What's included: Unlimited beer, wine & soft drink, and an unlimited casual buffet!

How much you ask?
Access: $40, Non Access: $45

Tickets will be available to be booked online edsoc.org.au/tickets from Monday 28th April, 2014, and from the Office late next week!

So, join us for a fantastic evening to send out the semester in style (or not so much style)!

If you have any questions, contact events@edsoc.org.au

The Sydney Univeristy Education and Social Work Society will hold its Annual General Meeting on the 1st of April, 2014 at 1pm in the Common Room of the Education Building.

The Aim of this meeting will be to discuss and vote upon constitutional changes to the Society and to elect the Executive for 2014. Tis is a unique opportunity for you to have a say on how your Society is run, and furthermore a great chance for you to get involved. 

The Agenda for the Meeting was emailed to students on Tuesday 11th of March. Nominations for Executive positions are now open and can be submitted to president@edsoc.org.au

Light refreshments will be provided for members in attendance of the Annual General Meeting.

Come one come all to the EDSOC Cardie Crawl!

Don your finest (or not so finest) classic teacher gear, get out those tweed jackets with patches, and those nerdy glasses and join us for a bite to eat and a few drinks to welcome in the new semester! Come along to meet the Executive, bring your fiends and meet some of our new members!

As always, pizza and first drinks are on EDSOC at the first location!

description:
In Week 4, EDSOC will be running it's first Random Acts of Kindness!

On Thursday 22nd August 2013 between 10:00-11:30am, a team of friendly EDSOC volunteers will be around the entrance of the Education Building/Lawn, giving out free bags of delicious goodie treats! They will also be on hand to answer any of your questions regarding our upcoming events and opportunities this semester! 

Our aims are:
- To inspire others to practice kindness and pass it on to others
- To provide energy to students and encourage healthy eating habits
- To help everyone create a better world by spreading awareness and increasing engagement in kind actions

Feeling creative? We would love to include some of your creative thinking into this initiative. Simply answer this question: "What does kindness mean to you?" Your response can be in the form of a quote, short story, a few words or even a drawing or collage! Be creative! Please keep the maximum to 100 words. Submissions due by 9pm Tuesday 20/8/13.

Email your creative responses to: communications@edsoc.org.au 
Please include your name, degree and title of your work. 

Please feel free to invite your friends along and spread the kindness around. We look forward to seeing you at the EDSOC Random Acts of Kindness in Week 4!
place: Sydney University Education and Social Work Society
street: Room 406, Education Building A35, University of Sydney

event_name: Semester 2 Cardie Crawl and Games Night!
description:
Hey everyone! 

Welcome back to Semester 2!! Before uni gets a little too serious with readings, essays, pracs and portfolios, we invite you to have some fun at our Semester 2 Cardie Crawl!  

We've mixed things around a little bit this year and will be following a local route through Glebe, starting off at the Forest Lodge Hotel 
at 6pm with free pizza, wine and beer until the tab runs out. Come dressed in your most outrageous teacher cardigan and receive your "Report Card". This outlines the "school" challenges you need to complete at each pub to see if you're ready to go back to school. You're more than welcome to meet up with us along the way; with the final route being announced in the next day or two. 

The official route for the EDSOC S2 Cardie Crawl & Games Night:

6-7:30: The Forest Lodge Hotel
7:30-8:30: Bedlam Bar, Glebe (Cnr Parramatta & Glebe Pt Rds)
8:30-9:30pm: The Lansdowne
9:30-10:30pm: The Abercrombie
10:30-11:30pm: The Clare Hotel
11:30- Onwards: Bar Broadway.

Our pub crawl will take us all the way down to central, so its close to transport! Cardigans + Good Company + Great Venues + Easy Transport +Fine Beverages + A Charitable Donation= One amazing night!!!!!!

It's $5 for attending with the money raised going towards the Sydney Story Factory.

To read more about the Sydney Story Factory, and how you may like to get involved, please click the link below:

http://www.sydneystoryfactory.org.au

Looking forward to seeing you there!

event_name: Cartoon and Comic Book Character Cruise
description:
It's that time of year again, where we educators and social workers don our fabulous costumes for a night upon the water.

This year, we relive our childhood, with a Cartoon and Comic Book theme. Embrace your early adolescence with hommage to your favourite cartoon, comic book or video game.

For just $45 (ACCESS) or $50 (non-ACCESS) you will spend a glorious four hours upon on the waters of Sydney Harbour, with unlimited alcohol and a delicious buffet dinner.

Costumes are compulsory, and heartily endorsed, with prizes for best dressed being announced on the night.

Details of the cruise are as follows:
Date: June 7, 2013
Time: 7:15 to 11:30pm
Duration: 4 hours
Theme: Cartoon and Comic Book Character
Cost: $45 (ACCESS) and $50 (non-ACCESS)

Tickets can be purchased in cash from the EDSOC office, or online by contacting the Treasurer via treasurer@edsoc.org.au

N.B: Be aware that if your nemesis arrives, you may be forced to have a dance off to declare your victory. Theme music may be included.

THIS IS TODAY. Ed Lecture Theatre 351 at 5pm. Be there!

You are invited to attend the first ever TeachMeet USyd, hosted by the University of Sydney Education and Social Work Society!!!

A free event for all teachers to encourage and be encouraged by the next generation of educators. 

"TeachMeets are gatherings of professional educators who wish to share, support and inspire each other to provide engaging learning experiences for our students." 
(TeachMeet Sydney Host Pack)

Presenters will range from experienced teachers to passionate and innovative academics to pre-service teachers, guaranteeing an insightful and fun evening, as well as a fresh look at what we do in the classroom each day. Come along, bring your teacher friends, and get keen to learn from one another!

Food and drinks will be provided, and dinner will be held afterwards at one of the many great venues near the Uni.

Check the TeachMeet USyd Wiki closer to the date for more information as to how you can get involved in presenting.

http://tmsydney.wikispaces.com/  

We look forward to seeing you there!!!

Note: NSTs are able to claim attendance and participation in TeachMeets as "Teacher Identified" hours of PD for accreditation purposes with the NSWIT.
place: Sydney University Education and Social Work Society
street: Room 406, Education Building A35, University of Sydney

event_name: EDSOC Presents: Interfaculty Sport BBQ- Semester 1, 2013
description:
Hi Everyone, 

EDSOC is hosting a gold coin donation BBQ to support our fellow students in Interfaculty Sport. Come down and support our colleagues! Tickets for our Semester 1 Cruise will also be purchasable from this event!

We hope to see you there!

Below is the event detail from the Education & Social Work Interfaculty Sport page!

THIS IS IT.

It is time, as the famous EDUCATION FACULTY to truly cement our mark within 2013 interfaculty sport. We are currently dwindling behind the pretentious LAW faculty and unknown DENTISTRY faculty. The men's soccer competition will catapult us into 1st position on the leadership board.

So get INVOLVED!

Options - 
1. Take part in our rigorous training sessions performed by our soccer expert's Steve Georgakis and Paul Bentveltzen. These training days have been scheduled for - 
Monday 29 April 2pm-3pm and Tuesday 30 April 2pm-3pm. Both sessions are on the Square.
You MUST turn up to BOTH training session - this is serious. YOU WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED, if you do not turn up!

2. Come on down and SUPPORT your faculty, 12noon Wednesday 1st May down at the square. A BBQ with gold coin donation will be provided by EDSOC for all Education supporters. 

Celebratory drinks and steaks will proceed down at the ROYAL at 3ish depending on the finish time of the finals!

GET KEEN, this day will go down as one of the greatest days in interfaculty sport history, so dont miss out!

The Education and Social Work Society will be conducting its Annual General Meeting on Wednesday the 20th of March at 1:00pm in the Education Common Room. 

In accordance with the Constitution of the Society, two weeks notification is provided for this meeting. Details of the meeting may be found below and at the University of Sydney Union Website.

Elections:

The 2012 Executive of the Society will be dissolved on the 20th of March pending election at the aforementioned AGM. In line with this two week notice period. All members of the Society are able to nominate for an Executive position. Nominations for the below positions will close at 5pm on the 19th of March, 2013. As per the Constitution, no more nominations may be accepted once the notification period has closed.

The following Positions are available for nomination

President (1)*
Vice-President (2)*
Secretary (1)*
Treasurer (1)*
Events Officers (2)
Communications and Marketing Officer (1)
Fundraising & Sponsorship Officer (1)
Equity & Welfare Officer (1)
Information Technology Officer (1)
Not more than ten (10) General Executive Positions.

If you intend to nominate for a position, please register your interest by emailing president@edsoc.org.au. 
The Society will provide relevant information to you, or request a meeting depending on the position nominated for.

Please note, that to hold an executive position within the Society, you must be a current member of the University of Sydney Union and hold a current Access Card. You will be asked to provide this upon reception of your nomination. 
Please also include a brief blurb about yourself and why you are nominating for a position. Please include your degree program and your teaching areas if applicable.

Agenda:

The Agenda for the Meeting will be set by Anne Barker, Secretary of the Society, and will be made available to all members once nominations have closed.

All students are members of the society, and are able to raise general or other business at this meeting. If you have concerns that you wish to raise, please contact secretary@edsoc.org.au
place: Faculty of Education & Social Work, The University of Sydney Room 401

This is the second formal meeting of the Society for 2012. Students are invited to attend and hear what is currently happening within the society, hear about our new events and have a say in the direction of the Society.

We hope you can all make it

Extra! Extra!

Read all about it! 

EDSOC's Annual  Harbour Cruise!

This year, the Education and Social Work Society Semester 1 Cruise will wind back the clock to a stylish, booming and classy era! The boat will be transformed into a 1920's Speak-easy so come dressed in your favourite flappers & gangsters attire! (Fishnets are always welcome.. lol jks).


But seriously

The Details:

When: Friday, June 1, 2012
Where: The boat departs from King Street Wharf
Time: 7:15pm for marking off in time for a 7:30 departure

What you get:

- Unlimited casual buffet (please inform us of your dietary requirements, and the cruise company will do its best to accommodate these).
- Three hour cruise on the beautiful Sydney Harbour!

How much you ask?

Access: $40.00
Non Access: $45.00

(yes, it's that cheap!)

Tickets are available from the EDSOC Office (Room 406, Education Building, A35) or email treasurer@edsoc.org.au to arrange for EFT payment.

Feel free to invite your friends, even those who don't study within the faculty or the University are more than welcome.


The Education and Social Work Society & The University of Sydney Union support the responsible service of alcohol.

This is an 18+ Event, ID will be checked upon arrival.

Welcome Back to Semester 1!!

Lets kick of the year in traditional EDSOC style with our annual carrie crawl through the rocks, this coming Thursday the 8th of March.

Get decked put in your nerdiest teacher or social worker gear and come and have dinner and a drink on EDSOC at our first destination!

11:30pm — The Lowenbrau, cnr Playfair and Argyle Streets


Please RSVP  ASAP to this event. There is no charge to attend this event.

We hope to see everyone there to kick of the year in style! This is just one of our fantastic events coming up for Semester 1!





The University of Sydney Education and Social Work Society and the University of Sydney Union support the responsible service of alcohol.

Come join us for a night of ghouly mischief and ghostly horror. Let your hair down, and let your scary side show (for once, not in a classroom or social work setting).

This year, the ball is Halloween and will fall on Friday October 28. It will be held as a private function in the AB Hotel in Glebe.

Details are as follows:
Friday October 28.
Venue: The AB Hotel, Glebe Point Road
Theme: Halloween
Tickets: $65 for access and $70 for non access

Your ticket gets you a night of EDSOC mayhem in our exclusive function room, a meal and drinks, and access to our Best Costume competition.

Meal options are below:
• Drinkers: Garlic Bread, Main Course and Petit Fours. 5 servings of alcoholic beverages and unlimited soft drinks.
• Non-drinkers: Main Course and (a proper) dessert. Unlimited soft drinks.

As always, non-Education or Social Work students are more than welcome, as are partners and friends from outside uni, however tickets are STRICTLY limited and sales cut off on Monday October 10. There will be no extension of this date.

Get your ghoul on!

We need YOU to bake some delicious goodies to sell at our stall, OR to come buy the delicious goodies we sell at our stall.

We're open to cakes, biscuits, cupcakes, friands; anything really. Come and support your society and help us raise money for our social events for this semester!

Come and join your fellow educators and social workers for a night aboard a magic carpet of a vessel as you tap into your own Arabian Nights dreams.

Think Aladdin, genies, belly dancers and flying carpets. Think deserts and magic and mystery. Costumes will be encouraged and applauded.

The event will be departing from a wharf in the CBD to be announced closer to the event.

Tickets are $50 for ACCESS and $60 for non access. Covered in the ticket price is all you can eat pizza and  beer, wine and soft drink for the duration of the cruise, which is a whole FOUR hours this year!

Friends from other faculties and universities are more than welcome, but ticket sales will cut off ONE WEEK prior to the event, so all tickets must be purchased before then.

The event is NO LONGER an 18+ only event. Under 18s will be allowed though alcoholic beverages will not be served to them. Tickets are strictly limited by boat capacity, so buy quickly to make sure you don't miss out!

Grab your friends and throw on your best professional (read: nerdy) garb and head down to The Rocks for a great night out with fellow students from the faculty.  Friends from other faculties are very welcome!

Our first destination on our bi-annual cardie crawl through The Rocks (The Australian Hotel) will have a drinks and pizza tab for members of the society who arrive before the tab runs out.

The Cardie Crawl is a great EDSOC tradition and is the first big social event of  the year. Come along and meet new people, make new friends and make the most of your university experience!

event_name: Why Public Policy Matters: With Karen Chester
description:
Public policy: seen by some as the embodiment of practical economics, and by others as a minefield of sacred cows and political constraints. Come along next Thursday to discover why Karen Chester - Deputy Chair of the Productivity Commission and one of the highest ranking economists in the country - moved from policy to private sector investments, and back again.

Ms. Chester will be speaking for around 40 minutes regarding her career, how she came to be in public policy, and why public policy matters more generally. There will be another 20 minutes dedicated to Q&A at the end. 

Ms. Chester’s Biography:
Karen Chester was appointed a Commissioner with the Productivity Commission in December 2013 and Deputy Chair in May 2016. 

Prior to her Government appointments, Karen was a Partner at Mercer and Global Head of Infrastructure.  Before joining Mercer, Karen was a Partner at Access Capital Advisers, having been the CEO of its corporate predecessor ─ Access Economics.  Karen has also held directorships on several Australian infrastructure company boards and before moving to the private sector held senior economic policy roles in the Australian Treasury and the Department of Prime Minister and Cabinet.

In 2015, the Government appointed Karen to Chair an expert panel to undertake a capability review of ASIC. 

Karen has a first class honours degree in economics from the University of Queensland.     

Event details:
The event will be held at 5:10PM in ABS Seminar Room 2110. 

We look forward to seeing you there!

event_name: Federal Budget Analysis + Q&A with Chris Richardson
description:
For fiscal aficionados and interested amateurs alike, the University of Sydney Economics & Econometrics Society presents: Budget Analysis and Q&A with Chris Richardson.

Chris Richardson is a Partner at Deloitte Access Economics and is one of Australia's best known economists. Chris heads Deloitte Access Economics' forecasting and modelling unit. He is the author of three regular publications: Business Outlook, Employment Forecasts and Budget Monitor. His comments on trends in the economy and their effect on business regularly appear in daily media coverage.

For those playing along at home, a quick visit to Google's News tab results for Chris Richardson will give you an idea of Chris's exceptional breadth of experience as a fiscal commentator.

So swing by ABS Seminar 1080 on Tuesday 6 June at 5PM for the opportunity to hear Chris's thoughts on the Budget as well as the Australian economy generally. You will also have the opportunity to ask any questions you may have regarding the topics discussed.

This event is open to absolutely anyone interested in the economics of the recent Federal Budget, whether you study econ, comm, govt or are simply an interested student from another discipline.

Like Economics? Like mid-weekly schooners? Then does Econsoc have the event for you. 

The newly rebooted Usyd Economics & Econometrics Society will be hosting casual drinks at Hermann's on Wednesday Week 11. Swing by from 5PM to say hi to the newly elected executive and have a chat with other students. 

Students from all years and all disciplines (who are interested in economics) are welcome!

event_name: EcoSoc Lecture Series - Economics of Passport Demand
description:
Join Sydney University Economics & Econometrics Society for our first in what is expected to be a regular lecture series.
We'll be hearing from Adam Elderfield An Economist focusing on Macroeconomic Policy and Forecasting from Deliotte Access Economics.
 
Adam has worked with Deloitte Access Economics for 3.5 years as an economist in the Macroeconomics Policy and Forecasting team. As a part of his responsibilities, Adam manages and maintains Deloitte Access Economics’ Macroeconomic model of the Australian economy.   
 
Adam will talk about his experience with Deloitte Access Economics to date and discuss in detail a recent project he has completed for the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade – “Forecasting the demand for Australian passports”.

Pizza and drinks will be provided by the club after the lecture.
Pizza and drinks will be free to ACCESSand $10 to non-ACCESS.
We'll also be selling cruise tickets after this event as well. If you want to buy ahead check out the 2nd Annual John Nash Cruise

event_name: Sydney University Economics and Econometrics Society Journal
description:
Ever been interested in writing on an economic topic of your own interest but had nowhere to submit it to? Ever thought certain government policies were cooked and wanted to tell your fellow students?
We're bringing our first publication as a club, purely written by students, and we want your work. We're after a range of different pieces, from short form to more indepth articles.
Articles should be 750-2500 words, and can be on any economic topic of your choosing. When referencing please ensure to footnote all work. We'll be taking submissions up until Christmas to get this ready for O Week next year, and a full PDF will be available on our website when completed.
This is a great way to increase your writing profile and learn how to communicate any research or ideas to the lay person.

Submissions can be sent to: usyd.ecosoc@gmail.com
Please include a picture you'd be happy for us to include with the article when you submit your piece.

event_name: Vivid Sydney Presents Purple Sneakers Eleventh Birthday
description:
VIVID Sydney Presents Purple Sneakers Eleventh Birthday

In case you missed it, last year’s Purple Sneakers Tenth Birthday celebration was one of the events of Vivid Sydney 2016. Those who were there will remember a line stretching around the block all night, hundreds of punters, nearly 30 acts over three stages, and more good vibes than we could have ever hoped for! 
 
The event featured the two things that matter most to Purple Sneakers: new emerging club music, and the Sydney music community. And as such the lineup we presented included some of our favourite emerging artists (incl. Moonbase, MEZKO, World Champion, Lastlings & more), as well as some of our favourite Sydney music community friends like Astral People, Linda Marigliano, Pilerats, Motorik, Stoney Roads, Andy Garvey, Sidechains, UNDR Ctrl, Luen Jacobs and many more. 
 
So, it made sense to do it all again this year as we blow out an extra candle on the birthday cake on Saturday 17th of June!  
 
For this year’s event, we’ve continued to carefully curate a lineup of exciting up-and-comers that we have supported on the blog and have loved to see grow over the past 12 months. The live stage will feature the internet hip hop poetry of Kimchi Princi; the forward-thinking production of Ninajirachi, the upbeat pop of Gussy; the serene sounds of OKBadlands, the futuristic sounds of Sortagoth, and the captivating electronica of Willaris. K. 
It wouldn’t be a Purple Sneakers party without a few community friends in the mix though, would it? Joining our live room will be two other stages just like last year - this year playing host to collectives and Sydney legends like Bad Deep, Fling Fling, Heaps Gay DJs, Kali Picnic, LOW TON, Matka, Mowgli May, Sandro Dallarmi, Sidehustle, SURG, Trench Records, Volumes, and of course Purple Sneakers DJs, as well as a very special DJ set from Christopher Port. 
 
Held at our spiritual home of The Lord Gladstone in Chippendale from 5pm to 3am, this year’s event will again be free entry, so we recommend you come down early as entry will be first in, first served.  
 
Purple Sneakers Eleventh Birthday is presented by world renowned cultural institution Vivid Sydney, Young Henry’s, and Sydney’s FBi Radio, who recently invited Purple Sneakers to broadcast on the main station, after presenting a show for 3 years on electronic music focused sister digital station FBi Click. 
 
So join Purple Sneakers as we celebrate another birthday as a tribute to all that we’ve done over the past year as a music community, a blog, a radio show, and so much more. 
 
Full lineup and details below. See you there! 

Vivid Sydney Presents Purple Sneakers Eleventh Birthday

Date: Saturday 17th June 2017
Venue: The Lord Gladstone
Time: 5pm – 3am
Address: 115 Regent Street, Chippendale, Sydney
Price: Free entry

event_name: TODAY: Video Killed the Radio Star: Presented by MECOSOC / Honi / SURG
description:
Video killed the radio star...or so Bruce Woolley and The Camera Club sang in 1977. But times have changed —  the retro revolution is upon us, cassette sales are at their highest in a decade, and podcasting has made radio ~ cool ~ again. 

So what does this mean for the future of media? Join us at 5:30PM for a 6:00PM sharp start on 5th June for a night of drinks and talk as we speak to some of the biggest names in Australian media for some of that sweet, sweet democracy as they battle it out to prove the worth of their form in an ever-changing media landscape.

Keep an eye on this event as we announce our surprise guests!

This event is hosted by Sydney Uni MECO Society (MecoSoc), Honi Soit, and SURG FM. Provided by the USU.

event_name: SURG FM Compulsory Broadcaster Training ~Featuring Chris Taylor~
description:
Hey SURG-ers welcome back to another semester!

THIS IS NEXT WEDNESDAY THE 12TH.

Our two presenters are Chris Taylor (of Chaser fame) and Michael Bradley (Managing Partner of Marque Lawyers).

Chris Taylor needs no introduction, but it's worth recalling the fact that as a Triple J presenter he promised to do a nudie run at Big Day Out if the Media Watch theme song was voted into the Hottest 100 (it did, and he did).

Michael Bradley's most recent high-profile case was the Dallas Buyers Club decision that made national headlines earlier this year. He has also represented Sony and Penelope Cruz. Bradley is almost as famous for his office eccentricities, which include having law students apply for clerkships by making a diorama, and giving all his staff $400 to spend on a pair of shoes.

We will be covering:
- Tech: how to use the MECO studio
- Content: how to make good radio
- Legal: defamation and media law in a community radio context

It is ESSENTIAL that you or your co-host attends training if you intend to have a show this semester. This goes for people who had a show last semester. Pizza and drinks at Courtyard are included in the price!

ACCESS + SURG Member $3
ACCESS non SURG member $5
Non-ACESS $11

We will be on Eastern Avenue for O Day signing up new members, broadcasting and talking to everyone about SURG. Feel free to swing past our stall and ask any questions you might have, or even just to hang out with our awesome exec.

New upcoming events including:
- Semester 2 Welcome Drinks
- Broadcaster Training/Legal Training
- Fortnightly Drinks
- 25- Hour Verge Broadcast

Note: If you signed up at O Week or during Semester 1 you do not need to sign up again.

Hope to see you all!

We are pleased to present our Broadcaster Training, with our wonderful industry professionals Andrew Denton (formerly of Triple M), Alex Dyson (Triple J), Georgia Hitch (FBi) and Caroline Gates (FBi). We extend our thanks to each of them for volunteering their time to talk to our members. 

Food and drinks will be provided at the event. If you have dietary requirements please notify us as soon as possible at surgfmpresident@gmail.com and we will do our best to cater to you.

SURG Members ~ $5

The evening will begin with our presenters talking about how to go about making different types of radio shows. There will be an opportunity for Q&A. 

We will then move to the Holme Building for studio training.

We're kicking off what we hope will be another fantastic year with our welcome drinks in week one, a great chance to meet the 2015 exec, mingle with broadcasters and discuss all the rad ideas you have for radio shows this year.

description:
We've got our AGM on soon. We are electing all the positions for the SURG FM 2015 team. All the positions are up for grabs; President, Vice President, Secretary, Treasurer, Technical Officer, Media Officer, and two General Executives.

The meeting is in the Manning Meeting Room which is the room in the back corner of the middle level of Manning. It looks like it may be a storage cabinet.

If you have any questions shoot an email to president@surgfm.org, of if you would like to nominate yourself or a friend for a position send an email as well.

Nominations close at 3 pm October 16.

In honor of  Verge Festival SURG is turning into VURG FM for the two weeks of the festival. During the festival we will be interviewing bands, hosting the closing night party, and showing a film as part of the Verge Film Festival.

Sam and Mitch of Born to Lose will be on the North Stage from 1-2 on Wednesday.

Emily from Around the World in 60 Minutes will be on the North Stage from 102 on Friday the 10th.

Ben of Friendly Neighborhood will be on the South Stage on Wednesday the 15th from 1-2 pm.

Seb and Harriett from Real Talk will be closing out the festivities at the Closing Night Party from 6-8 on the 17th.

We are also showing a movie on Thursday the 9th at 6:30 in the International Student Lounge. The movie is called Radio Days. It's by Woody Allen. Come along for an enjoyable evening.

Keep tuned in to VURG for all your Verge related news.

We are looking for some lovely people to join our executive team. Specifically we are looking for a publicity officer, a tech officer, and two general executive.

As the publicity officer you will be responsible for SURG's public face both on and off campus. You will take charge and have initiative on things that will grow awareness of SURG on campus, as well as help coordinate parties and improve the SURG broadcaster community.

Technology officer will liaise with the MECO department to sort out all the technical issues that pop up over the semester. You will also be in charge of running live broadcasts.

General exec fill the gaps that inevitably arise with the busy schedule of a student.

All roles require commitment, and reliability. Please don't run if you are not going to be involved with SURG in 2015, we need to build a strong exec for the coming year.

If you have any questions send an email to surgfmpresident@gmail.com, and if you are interested in running please email no later than 3:30 pm on Monday the 11th of August.

If you are keen to get on the radio this coming semester be sure to come along to the training session. We have a bunch of Sydney radio greats lined up to talk to you about organizing, producing, and presenting content for the air waves.

Watch this space for an announcement of who will be talking.

Training is compulsory for anyone that wants to broadcast, even if you have attended SURG training in the past.

Costs are;
Member: $3
Non-member with access: $7
Membership with Training: $10
Non-member without access: $13

Please don't arrive later than 5:45 so we can start promptly at 6.

We are super excited to be back on air. We want ot share some of the excitement with you. Come on down to Hermanns on Thursday the 27th to celebrate SURG going back on air for another semester.

We will have some great music for you provided by our friends Beat the System (USYD Music Society). The lineup is to be announced later, but it's sure to be killer.

Members get a free drink, non-members get a free drink for 7 dollars. Membership is 7 dollars so if you aren't a member this may be a great chance to become one.

description:
Hola boys, girls, and automobiles!

We've got our training for semester 2 coming up on August 12. This will be a scaled back version of semester 1's training intended for those new to the society who haven't trained or broadcast before as well as anybody who'd like a bit of a refresher. 

We'll have Chris North from Triple M here to teach you all about content, and Rob Morrison formerly of Hot FM (Southern Cross Austereo's WA presence) to talk you through panelling. 

Details
Where: Holme Student Lounge
When: August 12
Time: 6 - 8pm
Who: Those who haven't broadcast before and anybody after a refresher

See you there peeps!

Hi everyone,

The constitutional changes from our last GM have finally been approved, which means we have some new executive positions. In some sad news too, our current (and great) treasurer, Ben Tang, will be leaving us in semester two, which means that the positions up for election are:

- Two General Executives
- One Technology Officer
- One Treasurer

We will also be updating the audit month in our constitution. 

If you're interested in getting more involved in our awesome radio station, making some great friends and learning new skills, please nominate for these positions! Send all nominations to surgfmpresident@gmail.com

Here is a description of the roles of the new positions:

5.6	   The Technology Officer shall:	

i)	Maintain the Society’s website and email accounts, and provide login details to the other executive members, in order for them to post updates about the Society.
ii)	Maintain the online stream of the radio shows of the Society’s members.
iii)	Liaise with the Digital Media Unit staff in regards to broadcast equipment.


5.7	   The General Executives shall:

i)	Assist the rest of the executive in performing their duties, by carrying out delegated tasks
ii)	Help organise and ensure the smooth running of the society’s events and meetings

If you have further questions about the new exec roles and what they will entail please feel free to email Annie or myself (msch7190@uni.sydney.edu.au). 

I hereby declare nominations for these positions open, as well as for the position of treasurer. Nominations will close at 5pm, Monday May 27th. 

Peace, y'all.
place: Isabel Fidler Room, Level 2 Manning House

event_name: SURG FM Broadcast Launch Party in conjunction with the USU and Beat the System
description:
On Thursday at Hermann's there's going to be some bangin' tunes provided by The Trouble with Templeton, Sures, Maples and the BTS DJs. It's the USU's Mid-Semester Party so you know it's going to be a big one!

This is also going to be our broadcast launch as we should be good to go starting Monday April 22!

AND we have a double pass to SUPAFEST to give away. 

The drinks are on us :)

Free for Access
$10 for non-Access
street: University of Sydney, Cnr City Rd & Butlin Ave Butlin Ave

event_name: SURG FM Compulsory Broadcast Training: How to make radio and alienate ear drums
description:
And so the time has come!

It's taken a little while but we've finally got our Semester 1 training date confirmed. 

This is THE single most important SURG FM event of the semester in terms of your future broadcasting career. We'll be training you up so you can not only propose shows to us but actually put them on! The night will go for approximately 3.5hrs and cover everything you need to know.

On the content side we have Chris North (comedian, announcer from Merrick and the Highway Patrol on Triple M), Annamarie Reyes (Volunteer and Training Coordinator 2SER, Executive Producer of On the Money and Radio Atticus 2SER, former ABC and SBS foreign correspondent) and a mystery music show guest. They'll be chatting to you about the areas of radio they work in and what sort of content you might want to put on your show. You'll also get a chance to break into smaller groups with each presenter to chat more specifically. 

On the production side we have Dominic Santangelo (MECO2601 Radio Broadcasting coordinator/lecturer, former Eastside FM drive host, musician) and Jacob Craig (Audio Media Officer for the Digital Media Unit, sound engineer, the guy on everybody's speed dial). Jacob will be showing you the ropes in the studio, teaching you guys how to not break the equipment and actually make your show sound good. Dom will be going through how to put together a radio show - preparation, organisation, content sourcing, last minute tips etc.

We'll be providing dinner so don't worry about that and I'm sure afterward there'll be enthusiasm for a post training beverage at The F'Lodge or similar. 

Also, this is a great opportunity to meet other keen broadcasters. If you don't have a show idea yet or don't know anybody else interested in SURG never fear, there WILL be somebody here for you! (gosh it sounds like a dating service, speaking of which...loljks)

You must be a member of SURG to broadcast but you can attend the training without being a member. Prices are as follows;

Member: $5
Non member with Access: $10
Non member without Access: $16
(SURG membership is $7 and you can sign up on the night)

Any questions please email Annie Wylie at surgfmpresident@gmail.com or call her on 0414 844 543 :)

This is a general meeting to amend the Radio Group club constitution to:
a) Create new executive positions; 2 general exec and 1 tech officer
b) update the constitution to bring it into line with the most recent changes to the C&S model constitution, for example, regarding meeting procedure and quorum. 

For further details, including specific changes to the constitution, please email Max (msch7190@uni.sydney.edu.au). Please also email Max for explanation of the expected roles and responsibilities of the proposed new executive positions.

PLEASE NOTE, there will be no election of the new exec members at this meeting, as the constitutional changes must first be approved by a C&S Committee meeting. 

Come along and learn more about your fabulous campus radio station!

Agenda:
1. 	Opening and welcome
2. 	Apologies and leaves of absence
3. 	Minutes of the previous meeting
4. 	Business arising from the minutes
5. 	Correspondence
6. 	Motions on notice
        a) To amend the society's constitution
            i) To create the new executive positions of Technology Officer, and two General Executives
            ii) To Update the aims and activities of the society to reflect developments of the past few years 
            iii) To bring the constitution into line with changes to the C&S model constitution
             iv) To organise social media updates for our members
7. 	Reports of Executive Members.
8. 	Other reports
9. 	General business
10. 	Date of the next meeting
place: Isabel Fidler room, level two, Manning Building, University of Sydney

description:
To kick things off with a slur we've decided to hold a casual welcome drinks for anybody thinking of being involved in SURG FM this year.

On the back of our win as the Best Club with over 100 members in 2012, this year is going to be bigger and better so come down to Hermann's and have a chat to those new and old. 

Members: FREE!
Access: $2
Non-Access: $8
street: University of Sydney, Cnr City Rd & Butlin Ave Butlin Ave

event_name: SURG FM End of Semester Party and Awards Night!
description:
It’s time. 

SURG FM is throwing a huge party and YOU are invited!

As most of you would know, SURG FM launched this semester as a full time internet radio station. It's kind of a big deal.

Therefore, on October 16 come on down to Hermann’s Bar at the University of Sydney for what is sure to be the best fun you’ve had since discovering porn back in high school…though a little bit different!

We’re having our End of Semester Party and Awards Night. There’ll be free drinks aplenty, nibbles to start and then everybody’s favourite pizza place, Parma, has generously partnered with us to provide delicious oversized slices for all!

On the back of appearances on SURG FM and Beat the System, Sean Ryan will be providing some laidback tunes to start the night off. After that we’ll be giving out awards to our best and brightest broadcasters. Categories will be announced closer to the date. Then DJ Floozy, the loosest DJ this side of Kentuckyshire, will be spinning beats until we’ve bled the bar dry. 

Prizes generously donated by;
The Smallest Gig: www.facebook.com/thesmallestgig
Oxford Arts Factory: www.oxfordartfactory.com/
The Finer Things: www.facebook.com/tftrecords
Dendy: www.dendy.com.au/Page/Home
ICON Films: www.iconmovies.com.au/
Campos Coffee: www.camposcoffee.com/
Papa vs Pretty: http://www.facebook.com/papavspretty?fref=ts

Free for Access
$10 for Non - Access

SURG FM would like to thank Parma Cucina and Bar and the University of Sydney Union for providing nourishment for this event.
street: University of Sydney, Cnr City Rd & Butlin Ave Butlin Ave

description:
'ello 'ello 'ello!

We've been broadcasting a few weeks now and you know what that means? Free drinks!

Let's all have a catchup over a couple of jugs at Hermann's on Tuesday the 18th. Find out if other broadcasters are having the same troubles/triumphs as you, bug me about getting security access again, put a face to that sultry voice you've been religiously tuning in for...

Meet at Hermann's and SURG will provide the social lubrication.

Free for Access card holders
$7 for non - Access card holders

Provided by the University of Sydney Union (USU) yay!
street: University of Sydney, Cnr City Rd & Butlin Ave Butlin Ave

event_name: Beach Quidditch Returns: Eyespeakables become friends!
description:
Beach Quidditch is back and better than ever, this time with the event being run by both USYD and UTS quidditch! 

Come down to Coogee beach this Saturday and enjoy a magical day with us on the sand, playing our favourite game with our favourite people. Absolutely everyone is welcome, no matter which jersey you wear (if you wear one at all), or your personal opinions on whether pineapple belongs on pizza (It definitely does!)

Please remember your sun safety! Slip on a shirt, slop on some sunscreen, slap on a hat, and make sure you bring a water bottle.

Is the lack of quidditch this summer causing your dunking muscles to atrophy? Are your forgetting the satisfying sound of your bludger hitting your target? 

USYD are hosting Wednesday Merc on 10/1 because we miss it a lot! Come to Victoria Park at 5.30pm for scratch matches, mismatched chaos and come hang at Broadway Shopping Centre afterwards.
street: Corner City Rd & Parramatta Rd Sydney

description:
Miss playing quidditch with the degree of wetness at QUAFL 2017? Want to re-engage in your Anakin Skywalker-like hatred for sand? Want to prove your skin's complete inability to tan wrong for once in your life, maybe? Come to Coogee on Friday where USYD Quidditch Club will be. 

Exact timing and positioning to come later, TBD by poll because democracy works all the time always. What we can tell you for sure is that Harry and Courtney will be coaching, so you'll learn exactly how to bench yourself and how to properly greet all one million of your bodily microbes in the most unsettling fashion.

Our Annual General Meeting where we will be electing a new executive and team committee members. To nominate yourself, fill in the nomination form and we will also be accepting nominations from the floor as nominees are announced for each role. If you have any questions regarding a role, there is a list of all roles and current holders at the bottom of this description.
We will also be voting on a few constitutional amendments (see link below)

Nominate yourself: https://goo.gl/forms/S4jaJWUlfVrernjv1

Amendments: https://www.dropbox.com/s/3v9ex2gt1hs6kz5/AGM%20Amendments.docx?dl=0

Voting for executives & committee will be done by ballot with the Single Transferable Voting method for each role with multiple positions available and/or multiple nominees. 
Single positions with one nominee will require a vote of confidence, and two nominees for a single position will be first to attain 50% of the vote. 
STV voting explained here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bLH_w5kHJpA
