Looking for something sweet amidst all your studying/procrastinating/sun-baking?

Come down to the New Law Lawns this Monday where the Quidditch Club will be hosting a bake sale! Come along for all your Harry Potter/quidditch related confectionary needs, and solve your end of semester studying woes with food :D 

Open from 10 to 3 (or whenever we sell out) on Eastern Ave"

event_name: USyd Quidditch DADA Class: Laser Tag
description:
Drop your textbooks and draw your wands! Dumbledore’s Army needs you. This week, we’ll be learning the ways to train our wand skills and defend against the Death Eaters coming after us. 

Join the USyd Quidditch Club as we play Laser Tag (and Bowling or Pool) on Wednesday. To make things even better, you can play quidditch before Laser Tag at Mac Merc from 5:30-7:00pm. (What is Mac Merc? It's a weekly casual quidditch fun game hosted by Macquarie, you rock up and form teams on the spot then play games. It's a good way to play with non-USyd people and practice some skills or positions you don't normally get to try - check out the group here - https://www.facebook.com/groups/768609123260283/).

Laser Tag is at Strike Macquarie in Macquarie Centre (alight at Macquarie University Station if going by train). See you there!

This is an event open to anyone - i.e. we'd love if people from Mac (Merc) and others besides came as well :)

Merc event for this week is here: https://www.facebook.com/events/293105231191537/?acontext=%7B%22ref%22%3A%224%22%2C%22action_history%22%3A%22null%22%7D

Join us after training on the 6th for Fortnightly Foodie Friday!

For this week, we'll have some really good Vietnamese food at Golden Lotus in Newtown. See you there!

Welcome to the first ever USyd Internal Fantasy: A tournament for USyd Quidditch players past and present!

The idea of this is to bring everyone back together, mix old and new, and spend a day doing what we all love most. 

You can register for the tournament here:  https://goo.gl/forms/qyFbjdZ5WIuA75Fz1

Registration fee is $15 to help cover field hire etc. You will be emailed payment details with confirmation of your registration.

This is a tournament for USyd players but we're trying to be fairly inclusive still. Therefore, to be eligibile to play, you must fill one of the following criteria: 
(1) Are a current member or have been a member of Sydney University Quidditch Society 
(2) Have been on the roster of / have played for a USyd Team
(3) Have been/are in one of the USyd Teams groups ("201X USU Quidditch Team(s)")

Our field booking is from 10am to 6pm, we intend to play some kind of round robin/double round robin format with finals, depending on the number of teams. Parking is available at the field, which is nearish Lindfield station, on the North Shore line. 

Pairs of Old and Current player co-captains will be chosen to choose teams in a draft (exact format yet to be determined but some kind of blind auction probably - some restrictions may be placed to promote roughtly even numbers of new/old players on teams, and roughly even numbers between teams). If you are interested in captaining (plz), you should indicate so on the form. 

We will also play an OldSyd vs NewSyd game at some point in the day, for banter. This will possibly involve a split of 2012-14 players vs 2015-17 players, or more probably a 50/50 split of players based on when they started playing, so that the NewSyd team doesn't blow out in numbers. May also be OldSyd vs CurrentSyd, depending on how the numbers work out/what will make for a more interesting game. 

We'll also be doing a BBQ lunch on the day (vego/vegan/healthy options available too). 

It should be a great chill day to catch up, have some fun, celebrate the long weekend, and play some quidditch - get hyped :D

Any queries can be directed by email to quidditchsoc@gmail.com, or via messenger to the society page.

Join us after training on the 22th for Fortnightly Foodie Friday!

For this week, we'll be checking out this new cafe in Glebe. See you there!

event_name: USYD Quidditch presents Harry Potter Trivia!
description:
Draw your wand, swing on your most dashing robe, and jump on your broom, as the Sydney University Qudditch Society presents Harry Potter Trivia.

On 20 September, Wednesday, grab a butterbeer and dust off your spellguides as you and your team battles it out for a treasure trove that would make a dragon emerald with envy. 

Please arrive at 7pm for a 7:30pm start, and we expect the competition to finish around 10:00pm.

There will be prizes for mini-games, the best dressed, and reigning champs of the night, so dust off your best dress robes, call the team together, and fly in before tickets fly out!

Quidditch Society Member: $7
Access Member: $12
Non-Access: $15

Registration forms are here.
For individuals: 
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1MyjBzaWJNpw5sPfZ20OWYrSyyC1iAfJcTdIb9Il5Bvc/
For teams:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1QE7oxWzS2Tcmk-7tH9EhqfX9s7BV3fFdWTxqLrFa5YE/

After signing up you will receive a confirmation email that you (or your team representative) must respond to, or your place may be offered to people on the waiting list. Payment information will be included in this email. When signing up you will need a team name, the members of your team, their Access card numbers and their membership status in the Usyd Quidditch Society. Tickets sold out within the day for last year's trivia so get in fast! (We'll give you plenty of warning before the form goes live :) ) 

Suggested team sizes are 6-10 wizfolk, and if you are struggling to find fellow comrades well-versed in the art of witchcraft and nerdistry, sign up as an individual and we'll find you a Harry Potter family for the night.

Note that trivia will cover EVERYTHING - the books of course, and movies, behind the scenes, the world of HP, the fandom, and of course, quidditch (both fictional and real life!).

If you have any questions please message this page or email quidditchsoc@gmail.com.
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

event_name: USYD Quidditch Mafia and Card Games!
description:
Deatheaters have infiltrated the sleepy town of Hogsmeade and villagers are dying every night! Can the villagers work out which among them are the Deatheaters? Can the healer save the innocent ones from death? Can the Auror discover who the Deatheaters are before it's too late? 

Find out on Thursday after training where we'll all head to the pub and, in USYD Quidditch Society tradition, play Mafia and card games the whole night!

Grab your quills and dust off your textbooks, it's time to take your O.W.L.s!

This Thursday, we'll go to Kelly's on King for Irish food and pub trivia! Will you need Calming Draught or just a shot of Firewhisky? We'll do whatever it takes to achieve an Outstanding O.W.L.

Since pub trivias are usually busy, please click going on the event before Wednesday if you're keen so we can book tables ahead. 

The menu for Kelly's on King is here: http://kellysonking.com.au/menu.html
Vegan/vegetarian options are a bit limited so if you don't like what they have to offer, feel free to grab food from other places on King Street and we'll save your spot for you at the table.

On Friday 1st September the Quidditch Society is hosting a General Meeting for our members to vote on a range of constitutional amendments.

The changes include a new name for the society, some minor restructuring of the executive (including more detailed exec responsibilities), as well as a range of minor numbering & grammatical fixes. We will also vote on re-wording several passages regarding the notice of meetings, to bring the society's constitution up-to-date with current C&S guidelines.

The full list of amendments to  be voted on is here:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/7g7fowxgkfl6k87/Constitutional%20amendments%20%281%29.docx?dl=0 

Entry is, of course, free for all our members & any other ACCESS members who wish to attend

Been coming to our quidditch trainings but still itching to get your feet off the ground and fly? Well, you can dust off your Firebolt because here's your chance!

We'll be hitting the skies this Saturday as we leap and bounce at Sky Zone, an indoor trampoline park with over 100 trampolines all connected to form one massive trampoline that will allow you to finally leave the gravity-afflicted Muggles on the ground!

It's $20 (inclusive of special Sky Zone socks, it's $18 if you already have a pair) for unlimited jumping the whole night. The jumping zones include a massive jumping area, basketball hoops, foam pit, and dodgeball courts (perfect for trampoline sproutball!).
Aside from trampolines, Sky Zone Alexandria also offers indoor climbing at $18/hour.

Remember to bring clothes you can jump around in!

The closest train station is Mascot Station and there are buses that stop nearby. If you're driving, you can find parking details here: https://skyzone.com.au/parking

Join us after training on the 25th for Fortnightly Foodie Friday!

For this week, we'll go casual with some classic burgers and fries at Soul Burger in Glebe. See you there!

Calling all Frog Choir members and Weird Sisters fans, get your voices ready as we practice singing 'Double Trouble' and 'Do the Hippogriff'!

After training this Thursday, we'll grab some dinner and maybe drinks at Bear Bar and then we'll let our capes down and 'wrock' the night out to some sick tunes (with the help of some Firewhisky of course!)

Everyone's welcome to come and jam with us!

Venue is at K-Square Karaoke in Capitol Square in Chinatown near Central Station.

Cost is around $20 per person for 3 hours. Please bring cash and ID (if you're drinking)! :)
street: Shop G4, Capitol Square, 730-742 George Street,

description:
Have you been too busy with uni to make it to trainings but still keen to meet quidditch people and hang out?

Then join us for our first fornightly Foodie Friday this semester after training at Lentil as Anything for a hearty meal and good times!

Lentil as Anything doesn't have set prices and people pay as they feel into the contribution boxes, but since we'll be a big group coming in and that'll require more volunteers to help serve us, they'll be requesting a $15 donation per person. :)

event_name: Play Quidditch at Sydney Uni (Friday Wk 2)
description:
This is our second training of week 2! Anyone wanting to come and try quidditch, this is your chance :D All genders, all abilities, all welcome. 

Quidditch is a fast paced, full contact, mixed gender sport, that's kind of a mix of rugby, basketball, dogdgeball, and Austag. We field three teams in the New South Wales Quidditch League and are open to anyone who wants to play :)

If you can't make our session today on Friday, come along on Thursday instead, and feel free to join in at any time/leave early if you need to! Event here: http://bit.ly/2v93Ptn

Make sure you bring a water bottle, wear clothes you can run around in/that can get a little muddy, and if you bave them, bring cleats/studs/football boots :) Feel free to jump in at any time! 

Check out some highlights videos/videos about the rules of quidditch here: 
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4pkcyuDnh40&t=12s
2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w6gWO8c7C1o
3. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZEz6WdBUa0A

event_name: USYD Quidditch Hogsmeade Trip (Newtown Pub Crawl)
description:
Quick! Look out your window - can you see that dark mark twinkling in the night sky? Put the Pumpkin Juice down and get the Butterbeer flowing… USYD Quidditch Society is signalling all 18+ muggles & magical creatures to give into their temptations and partake in sinister potions this approaching Thursday evening. 

We're halfway through a year of magic and quidditch and what’s a better way to celebrate than a trip to Hogsmeade, or as the muggles call it, Newtown?

Join us after Quidditch practice this Thursday and come to The Three Broomsticks (Hermann’s Bar) at 5:30pm! Come with friends, or come alone, our Prefects will make sure you feel welcome and won’t get lost and wander to the Hog’s Head. It'll be a magical night of butterbeer and firewhisky frivolity (or just pumpkin juice, if that's more your thing :) ).

Information about which pubs/bars we'll be hitting up and at what times will be forthcoming. 

Don't forget your Hogsmeade Permission Slips! (IDs)

See you there!

Sydney University Quidditch Society turns 5! Oh and Harry Potter turns 37 too.

Come celebrate five years of quidditch and magic in Sydney Uni on the first day of the semester! If you've always been keen to come try quidditch or get involved with Harry Potter events on campus, feel free to drop by and join us. We'll start the semester right with a toast to The Boy Who Lived.

We'll be hanging out at the Forest Lodge Hotel (Flodge, for short) from 6:00pm. See you there!

P.S. Bring your ID if you plan to drink some Firewhisky instead of Butterbeers :)

Have heard about quidditch being played in Sydney Uni? Curious to see what all the fuss is about?

Well come to Victoria Park (just behind the New Law Building) and watch our chasers score that quaffle, our beaters battle with their bludgers, and our seeker catch that elusive (and pesky) snitch!

We'll be having a quick introduction to the sport and a short demo game from 2:00 - 3:00pm. If you're keen, you can join in and play too! What better way to celebrate Harry Potter's birthday? 

Afterwards in the evening, we'll be celebrating both Harry Potter's and the society's birthdays at the Forest Lodge Hotel with some drinks and good times. More details here:
https://www.facebook.com/events/487860648241782/

If you don't feel like playing quidditch just yet, feel free to just come and watch, see how it works, and then come to our Come and Try days on Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday where we can give a more in-depth introduction to quiddtich:
https://www.facebook.com/events/318653825228049/
https://www.facebook.com/events/1613503432024321/
https://www.facebook.com/events/105198186829771/

Check out some highlights videos/videos about the rules of quidditch here: 
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4pkcyuDnh40&t=12s
2. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w6gWO8c7C1o
3. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZEz6WdBUa0A

Join us for the last Foodie Friday of the semester as we slurp on some ramen in Gumshara in Chinatown! If ramen's not your thing, then there are also other options in the food court.

Also, it's Kat's birthday so come celebrate :) There are plans to watch a movie (Wonder Woman) in George St after dinner and also to check out Vivid. So it'll be a fun night before studying for exams!
street: Eating World Harbour Plaza, Shop 211, 25-29 Dixon Street

description:
Come join us after quidditch training this Friday for some good times and strategy talk before Triwiz :)

The pub is offering cheeseburger, chips and a schooner for $17.
place: The Friend In Hand Hotel Glebe

event_name: USyd Quidditch goes Disco Ice Skating (plus 3rd Foodie Friday)
description:
Are you ready to get your boogie on? Because we're going ice skating y'all! Disco ice skating to be exact! 
Glide and slide to the latest pop and dance beats mixed by the resident DJ, while also enjoying the spectacular laser show and smoke machines.

The ice rink is at Macquarie Centre (alight at Macquarie University Station if traveling by train).

Prices are $23 for students and $24 for adults and includes skate hire. Students must provide valid ID at entry to receive student discount.

But if you can't make it to ice skating, don't fret cause we're also having our 3rd Foodie Friday after training. Come join us at Rice Paper in Newtown for some good Vietnamese food (vegetarian/vegan options included) before we all head off together to Macquarie Centre.

See you groovy things there!

'Honeydukes' finest have assembled to bring you the most delectable of magical confectionery treats. From pumpkin pasties to cauldron cakes, the Harry Potter bake sale promises to let you stuff your faces. 

The stall will be open from 11am-2pm on Eastern Avenue this Wednesday, so make sure to fly in! Unless you're fortunate enough to have a time turner, you lucky rubber duck!

event_name: USyd Quidditch DADA Class: Laser Tag
description:
Drop your textbooks and draw your wands! Dumbledore’s Army needs you.

Next week, we’ll be learning the ways to train our wand skills and defend against the Death Eaters coming after us. 

Join the USyd Quidditch Society as we play Laser Tag on Tuesday. If you’ve already started studying this Easter holiday, then it’ll be a good break, and if you haven’t started studying, well then it’s a good way to procrastinate!

Laser Tag is Strike Macquarie at Macquarie Centre (alight at Macquarie University Station if going by train).

Tuesdays is Cheap Uni Night (from 5pm onwards) at Strike so for $10 (if you show your student ID), you can get unlimited:
•	Laser tag
•	Bowling
•	Pool
•	Karaoke
And $4 Coronas and basic specials, plus $4 for 20 chicken wings.

*Please note: Due to liquor license regulations under 18s are NOT permitted in the venue after 8pm.

Calling all Frog Choir members and Weird Sisters fans, get your voices ready as we practice singing 'Double Trouble' and 'Do the Hippogriff'!

After training on Thursday, we can grab some dinner and maybe drinks at Bear Bar and then we'll let our capes down and 'wrock' the night out to some sick tunes (with the help of some Butterbeer of course!)

Everyone's welcome to come and jam with us!

Venue is at K-Square Karaoke in Capitol Square in Chinatown near Central Station.

Cost: $8.5 per person per hour
street: Shop G4, Capitol Square, 730-742 George Street,

event_name: USyd Quidditch and the Philosopher's Harry Potter Trivia!
description:
Double double, toil and trouble! This year, we'll be bringing you FOUR Harry Potter trivia nights - two per semester!  So draw your wand, swing on your most dashing robe, and jump on your broom, as the Sydney University Qudditch Society presents Harry Potter Trivia.

The first one will be on 11 April, Tuesday. Grab a butterbeer and dust off your spellguides as you and your team battles it out for a treasure trove that would make a dragon emerald with envy. 

Our second trivia night for semester 1 ("USyd Quidditch and the Chamber of Harry Potter Trivia" - you get the pattern...)  will be on May 9th, in week 9! (Event will go live closer to the time, but save the date!).

Please arrive at 7pm for a 7:30pm start, and we expect the competition to finish around 10:00pm.

There will be prizes for mini-games, the best dressed, and reigning champs of the night, so dust of your best dress robes, call the team together, and fly in before tickets fly out!

Quidditch Society Member: $7
Access Member: $12
Non-Access: $15

Registration forms are here:
For individuals: 
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1MyjBzaWJNpw5sPfZ20OWYrSyyC1iAfJcTdIb9Il5Bvc/
For teams:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1QE7oxWzS2Tcmk-7tH9EhqfX9s7BV3fFdWTxqLrFa5YE/

After signing up you will receive a confirmation email that you (or your team representative) must respond to, or your place may be offered to people on the waiting list. Payment information will be included in this email. When signing up you will need a team name, the members of your team, their Access card numbers and their membership status in the Usyd Quidditch Society. Tickets sold out within the day for last year's trivia so get in fast! (We'll give you plenty of warning before the form goes live :) ) 

Suggested team sizes are 6-10 wizfolk, and if you are struggling to find fellow comrades well-versed in the art of witchcraft and nerdistry, sign up as an individual and we'll find you a Harry Potter family for the night.

Note that trivia will cover EVERYTHING - the books of course, and movies, behind the scenes, the world of HP, the fandom, and of course, quidditch (both fictional and real life!).

If you have any questions please message this page or email quidditchsoc@gmail.com.
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

description:
This week's Foodie Friday is at The Pie Tin in Newtown!

Join us after training and the General Meeting on Friday for some tasty savoury pies and delicious dessert pies.

All welcome :)

Sydney University Quidditch Society will be holding a general meeting on the evening of Friday week 5, after training (7th April, 2017), from 5:30pm-7:00pm, in the Holme Reading Room. 

This meeting will be primarily for making some constitutional changes (see agenda below), electing a new General Executive member, and making some reports/plans for the year ahead.

If you would like to nominate yourself for election for the position of General Executive, please fill out this form: 

https://goo.gl/forms/sbnhsB9Q4W4egJ9h2

Agenda: 

1. Opening and Welcome
2. Apologies and Leaves of Absence
3. Minutes of the Previous Meeting
4. Business arising from the Minutes
5. Constitutional Amendments:

That 1. Name "The name of the Society shall be SYDNEY UNIVERSITY QUIDDITCH SOCIETY (SUQS)"

Shall be changed to "The name of the Society shall be SYDNEY UNIVERSITY QUIDDITCH CLUB (SUQC)" or "The name of the Society shall be UNIVERSITY OF SYDNEY QUIDDITCH CLUB (USydQC)".  

6. Exec Reports
6.1 President
6.2 Treasurer
6.3 Secretary
6.4 Other Executive Members
7. Election of the Executives
7.1. Up to 1 General Executive 
8. General Business
9. Date of Next Meeting
10. Close of Meeting

President - Ajantha Abey
VP (Int) - Kathryn Cooper
VP (Ext) - Samantha Chittendn
Treasurer - Justin Miller

Events Manager - JV James Lim
Sports Manager - Lachlan Chisholm 
Grievance Officer - WIllem de Gouw
Media and Communications - Miki Stancic and Zach Vidler 
General Executives - Pauline Liz, Cooper Fitzgerald, Courtney Buckley

An owl to every member of Dumbledore's army - your bravery, wit, cunning, and dedication is needed. Bring your wand and dragonhide gloves and meet at the Three Broomsticks. We are going on a hunt.

After breaking his soul up into several pieces and scattering them across the magical world, Voldemort has left a serious, not to mention gravely dangerous, task ahead for our Witches and Wizards. With clues, puzzles, codes and riddles hiding these Horcruxes, only the brave few will make it to the end and crush The Dark Lord's dreams of immortality.

The Sydney University Quidditch Society presents a scavenger hunt on April 6th, Thursday around campus and Newtown! In teams of 4-7, you'll be provided a list of Horcruxes to find and challenges to complete, with eternal glory for the highest scoring teams, and the most creative too.

Check-in will begin at 5:30pm, with brooms up at 6pm, touching back down at Hogsmeade (Newtown) Station at 8:30pm

Tickets are FREE for Sydney University Quidditch Society members, $2 for Access, and $5 for non-access card holders (general public).

You'll be able to pay on the day.

REGISTRATION
Follow this link! https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1PnZD_gEvZxqNruUnefGeOhlQE9lEIDRh5sOLoPIF7Ag/

If you have any questions please message this page or email quidditchsoc@gmail.com.

Join us for a casual post training teams/club dinner this Friday, at Alice's Thai in Newtown, ahead of our first tournament of the year!! :) 

We aim to make #FoodieFridays a fortnighly thing this year, just to hang out and chill. All welcome :)

Come along to the ISL for our first movie night* of the year! Possibly also our first movie night ever. I'm not actually sure. But these will be a regular thing this year! 

Tonight we'll be watching the first two Harry Potter movies. We'll be hosting various other movie nights througout the year as we gradually make our way through all the HP movies, Fantastic Beasts, and more! 

If you have interupting classes or whatever, no worries, just come whenever you can - we assume you won't need to be filled in on the plot points you missed :P 

See you there! 

*yes, ok, it's more of a Harry Potter movie late afternoon, but ISL doesn't do late bookings.

Quick! Look out your window - can you see that dark mark twinkling in the night sky? Put the Pumpkin Juice down and get the Butterbeer flowing… USYD Quidditch Society is signalling all 18+ muggles & magical creatures to give into their temptations and partake in sinister potions this approaching Friday evening. 

A year of magic and quidditch is upon us and what’s a better way to kick it off than a trip to Hogsmeade, or as the muggles call it, Newtown?

Get sorted into your House and meet your fellow Gryffindors, Hufflepuffs, Slytherins, and Ravenclaws! Compete in small tasks in Hogsmeade pubs to score points for your House and win the House Cup! 

Join us after Quidditch practice this Friday and come to The Three Broomsticks (Hermann’s) at 6pm to get Sorted! Come with friends, or come alone, our Prefects will make sure you feel welcome and won’t get lost and wander to the Hog’s Head. It'll be a magical night of butterbeer and firewhisky frivolity (or just pumpkin juice, if that's more your thing :) ).

Information about which pubs/bars we'll be hitting up and at what times will be forthcoming. 

Don't forget your Hogsmeade Permission Slips! (IDs)

See you there!

event_name: Usyd Quidditch Come and Try! (Friday Wk2)
description:
Quidditch is a fast paced, mixed gender, contact sport, and we are open to anyone of any ability joining :) 

This week we're going straight into training from 2-5pm, as we will be for the rest of semester. 

Whether you're just here because it's the magical sport from Harry Potter or you just want to try something new and pretty damn awesome, everyone is welcome. Trainings are pretty relaxed :) 

Come and Try!

event_name: Usyd Quidditch Come and Try! (Thursday Wk2)
description:
Quidditch is a fast paced, mixed gender, contact sport, and we are open to anyone of any ability joining :) 

This week we're going straight into training from 2-5pm, as we will be for the rest of semester. 

Whether you're just here because it's the magical sport from Harry Potter or you just want to try something new and pretty damn awesome, everyone is welcome. Trainings are pretty relaxed :) 

Come and Try!

event_name: USyd Quidditch Health and Wellbeing Day Demo Game!
description:
Wednesday 15th is Health and Wellbeing day at USyd and we are taking part by having a demo game on the front lawns! 

Physical activity is super important to most people's health and wellbeing, and especially if you're stuck in the library studying all the time, getting outside, having a run around, and taking a break can be incredible for your physical and mental health (as well as your studying!). 

Quidditch is a great way to get active! Quidditch is a fun and fast paced sport, with a variety of roles and positions to suit every kind of player :) We are open to people of all abilities and genders, so whether you've never played sport before and just want to have a relaxing casual couple of games, or whether you're really keen and competitive, this is the sport for you, and we have multiple teams to accommodate people's preferences.

If you have no idea how quidditch works - that's what today is all about! Come along, we will show how you the game works, we will run you through some basic drills and you'll get a chance to play actual quidditch! If you just want to come and watch, that's totally fine too :) 

If you'd like to find out more, check out all the content on our page, or shoot us a message :) 

Hope to see you there!

If you're keen to play more, we have two come and try sessions in Victoria Park on Thursday and Friday afternoon, from 2-5 pm :)

event_name: Quidditch Info / Come and Try! (Friday Wk1)
description:
Our second training for the year! Quidditch is a fast paced, mixed gender, contact sport, and we are open to anyone of any ability joining :) 

For week 1 we will be having an info session at 2pm in the Holme Common Room (Upstairs), followed by actual practice and playing quidditch from 3-5 in Victoria Park! 


Whether you're just here because it's the magical sport from Harry Potter or you just want to try something new and pretty damn awesome, everyone is welcome.

Come and Try!

event_name: Quidditch Info / Come and Try! (Thursday Wk1)
description:
Our first training for the year! Quidditch is a fast paced, mixed gender, contact sport, and we are open to anyone of any ability joining :)

Whether you're just here because it's the magical sport from Harry Potter or you just want to try something new and pretty damn awesome, everyone is welcome.

Come and Try!

event_name: USyd Quidditch Broadway Crown Meet & Greet
description:
We know first week of uni is super hectic and full of all kinds of things, so this year we're having two meet and greets, to try and accommodate everyone :) Feel free to come to one or both of them. 

This one - on Wednesday - is at the Broadway Crown, who have cheap drinks deals for students on Wednesday nights :) 

Come along and meet other people in the society, talk about Harry Potter, quidditch, uni, and whatever else takes your fancy :)

If you can't make this event, check out our other meet and greet event here - https://www.facebook.com/events/401562256875225/ and keep an eye out for loads of other events on our page.

event_name: USyd Quidditch Hermann's Meet and Greet!
description:
Our first event of the year! Come and swing by Hermann's for some chill fun times, meeting other members of the society, and talking quidditch, HP, how bad/great your timetable is, and whatever else takes your fancy :)

We know first week of uni is super hectic and full of all kinds of things, so this year we're having two meet and greets, to try and accommodate everyone :) Feel free to come to one or both of them. This one - on Tuesday - is being held at Hermann's bar, a classic local student hang out at Usyd. If you can't make this event, check out our other meet and greet event here - https://www.facebook.com/events/181668315660708/ and keep and eye out on our page for loads more events :)
street: University of Sydney, Cnr City Rd & Butlin Ave Butlin Ave

description:
Escape the crowds on Eastern Avenue this first day of O week by heading on down to Victoria Park to check out some real life quidditch! 

If you've ever wanted to try chase, beat, keep, or seek, this is your chance! Quidditch is fast paced, mixed gender, tactical, and the world's fastest growing sport. 

Feel free to just come along and watch and see what it's all about, or join in!

We are USyd's quidditch club and as well as playing quidditch and competing against other teams universities around the country, we also host a number of different Harry Potter related events and socials over the year. Come along, visit our stall, or check out our page to find out more :)
place: Victoria Park - The University Of Sydney

description:
Quidditch. Yes, that bizarre fictional game is in fact a very real, full contact, mixed gender, global sport. 

Yes, we do have a team. Two teams, in fact. This Info Day we'll be on the lawns in front of the Quad, playing demonstration matches to show you how quidditch works, which anyone is free to join in on. 

Quidditch prides itself on inclusivity and we welcome people of all genders, abilities, and sporting backgrounds. The sport itself is kind of like a mixture of rugby, basketball, dodgeball, and austag. Check out our highlights reel from 2015 here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZEz6WdBUa0A

How does it work? How do you score points? How does the snitch work? Come and find out and play :)

The 2016 Annual General Meeting for the Sydney University Quidditch Society will be happening on Thursday 27th October, from 5-7pm, in Holme Meeting Room 1.

Nominations are now open for all positions on the executive, including team committee, and all nominations can be submitted through this form: https://goo.gl/forms/X6E87SBAqPyBdiGh2
Because we are unsure of the future of the Unbreakables, we do not recommend holding an election for committee members for that team. The reason we are recommending this is that we don't know whether the team will exist in the future, and also people nominating for those positions may switch teams.

AGENDA
1. Opening and Welcome
2. Apologies and Leaves of Absence
3. Minutes of the Previous Meeting
4. Business arising from the Minutes
5. Correspondence
6. Motions on Notice
    6.1 Consideration of Constitutional Changes
7. Annual Reports
    7.1 President
    7.2 Treasurer
    7.3 Secretary
    7.4 Other Executive Members
8. Election of the Executives

    9.2 Up to two (2) Captains for each official existing team

10. General Business

12. Close of Meeting

All constitutional changes that are being proposed can be found here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/187-v9r2rxi4QIChOKVsOgXyNLGUKeSlY5GBnWQheDPQ/edit?usp=sharing

If you have any questions about what each position of the executive does, please message the current holders of these positions, as listed below.

event_name: Harry Potter Trivia - Let's Get Quizzical!
description:
This semester, we're bringing double the magic with TWO nights of trivia! So draw your wand, swing on your most dashing robe, and jump on your broom, because the Sydney University Qudditch Society presents Harry Potter Trivia. 

On the nights of Monday 19th and Wednesday 21st September the butterbeer shall flow and legilimency may become your greatest weapon as you and your team battle it out for a treasure trove that would make a dragon emerald with envy. Please arrive at 7pm for a 7.30pm start, and we expect the competition to finish around 9.30pm.

Registration:
Elect one person to sign up your team of 6-10 wizard folk, or if you don't have a team you can sign up as an individual and we'll organise a team for you to be on. 

Here is the TEAM registration form for groups of 6-10:
https://goo.gl/forms/o9pLsOpkjMcCGxnb2
And here is the INDIVIDUAL registration form:
https://goo.gl/forms/WxoZH6rvbKZFzcmd2


To give as many people as possible the chance to play, you are only able to come along one night. There'll be an option to sign up for the Monday (19th) night, Wednesday (21st) night, or no preference (for which we will email the team with at least a week's notice saying which night you'll be on). 

Ticket prices are:
Members $8
Access $12
Non-Access $15

Tickets will need to be paid before the night. Information to do so will be emailed along with a registration confirmation email. 

*Monday night will be hosted at Manning Bar 
*Wednesday night will be hosted at the Bevery, in the Holme Building, near the Courtyard Cafe

This is an event for persons 18+ 
SUQS and the USU support the responsible service of alcohol.

description:
***TICKET SALES HAVE CLOSED***
Attention all nerds, geeks and pop-culture fans,


SUTEKH, Pokémon Society and Quidditch society have joined forces to create the boat cruise of the year!

The theme: cocktail cosplay. 
So that's a cocktail outfit with cosplay twist, or vise versa. Or if you prefer just one or the other :)

We will be setting sail across the harbour on the 12th of August. For those who are just trying to get through semester one, this will be the third week of semester two. 

Tickets will cost:
$44 members of one or more of SUTEKH, Pokémon Society and/or Quidditch*
$46 Non-members (with Access)
$52 Non-access (general public) 

Access card holders are those who are members of the University of Sydney Union.

Prices include food, drink (that’s beer, wine** and soft drink) and an amazing night full of conversations about your favourite fandoms. As there is alcohol everyone will need to be over 18 with a valid ID.

The cruise will depart from King Street Wharf, Darling Harbour at 7:45pm SHARP and come back to dry land at 11:45. You will need to be there at 7:15 so that we can board on time.

We hope to see you on board!


Xx SUTEKH, Pokémon Society and Quidditch society


*Even if you are in multiple societies you are only eligable for 1 ticket
**Our societies and the USU support the responsible service of alcohol. Please drink responsibly.

Get ready to hit the skies on Friday night (Wk 11)! With DJs spinning wicked tracks and bludgers soaring by your side you'll be wondering why you would have spent your Friday night any other way. 

Entry is $15 for 3hrs+ of jumpin' and jivin' + $2 for special Skyzone socks (if you don't have a pair already), kicking off at 7pm til' late. 
Early notice, going Friday of Wk 11, so anyone who's interested can organise work and study commitments. 

*Skyzone is an indoor trampoline centre with several trampoline courts, foam pits, and running walls.

event_name: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Trivia
description:
Get ready for a night of the cunning and collaborative. For escapades of wit and valor. For a battle that will shower you in all the glory befitting one (or 10) truly deserving of the title 'Potterhead'.

There will be prizes for mini-games, the best dressed, and reigning champs of the night, so dust of your best dress robes, call the team together, and fly in before tickets fly out!

Quidditch Society Member: $8

Non-Access: $15

After signing up you will receive a confirmation email that you (or your team representative) must respond to by April 1st [no joke], or your place may be offered to people on the waiting list. Payment information will be included in this email. When signing up you will need a team name, the members of your team, their Access card numbers and their membership status in the Usyd Quidditch Society. event_name: Muggle Studies - Laser Tag and Bowling
description:
Draw your metal wand and get ready for a fight to the death - Muggle-style. 

Next week we'll be exploring the muggle realm, their strange ways of combat, and maybe, just maybe, discovering the illusive function of a rubber duck. If you've ever had an incling to find out more about these peculiar people then this is the night for you. And honestly, what more could you wish for on a Tuesday night?

The event will cost $20 per person, for unlimited laser tag and bowling until 10pm.

Quick! Look out your window - can you see that dark mark twinkling in the night sky? Put the Pumpkin Juice down and get the Butterbeer flowing…

USYD Quidditch Society is signalling all 18+ muggles & magical creatures to give into their temptations and partake in sinister potions this approaching Friday evening. 

On the night: Find your allies, form a team, and earn house points by completing the challenges whilst hopping from pub to pub. Those with the most points will win the USYD Quidditch Cup - filled with prizes & glory. 

Be careful of memory erasing spells, take photographic evidence to prove your guts & gall to the rest 
#Unspeakables #USYDquidditch

-- 

Since you have the chance to win fabulous prizes in our Hunt, there is an entry fee: $1 if you’re a Society member, $2 if you’re otherwise an access card holder, and $6 for a non-access card holder. All payments will be taken at check in. If you’re just interested in joining along for a pub crawl, that is free and you’re absolutely welcome!

Registration will open at 9am, Tuesday 8 March, and will close at 11pm on Thursday (if capacity isn’t reached before then). You can register as either as an individual or as a team (one registration per team). You will need your names, society member status and access card number, if applicable, for everyone registering. Teams can have a maximum of five people—if you register as less than 5, you will be joined with others to make friends. You will receive a confirmation email that you have successfully registered.

You can register via this link: http://goo.gl/forms/pSSkm6GiOO

The USU supports responsible drinking.

description:
Hello and welcome, and welcome back, to quidditch for 2016! To fly right in we're holding two information sessions this week to explain all you need to know about the sport, the society and the snitch! These will be held:

Thursday 3 March - Holme Reading Room - 2pm 
Friday 3 March - Holme Reading Room - 2pm 

Following this on both days we will migrate down to Victoria Park (behind the New Law/Carslaw Building) at about 3pm for our first training sessions and games! If you've always wanted to get on a broom and have a go playing quidditch, come on down and try it out!

Are you a Potterhead? Enthralled by the idea of a tackle-dodgeball sport? Looking to sprinkle a little magic into you university adventure? Then come meet your fellow muggles at Hermann’s Bar this Tuesday afternoon (Wk 1) and find out all about Quidditch and the USYD Unspeakables! 

We’ll be at Hermann’s on the grass area from 4 onwards where you can meet the team, grab some food and a drink (hello happy hour), and enjoy some jazzy tunes.
street: University of Sydney, Cnr City Rd & Butlin Ave Butlin Ave

description:
Dive In? More like Fly In!*

As part of O-Week 2016, Sydney University Quidditch Society and the University of Sydney Union proudly present muggle quidditch! Fresh off their third place finish at Nationals last year, come and meet your university team, the Unspeakables! Muggle quidditch is a mixed gender, tackle sport featuring five balls, six hoops, fourteen brooms and a whole lot of fun. Come on down and check it out -- beware stray bludgers but keep an eye out for the snitch! 

Can't make the demo game? No worries! Shoot us a message any time or during O-Week come down to our stall on Eastern Ave, introduce yourself and find out how you can get involved this year. We train twice a week during semester, Thursdays and Fridays from 2-5pm, and host a bunch of other great quidditch and Harry Potter themed events. 

*No, we don't actually fly.

Are you ready to #DiveIn to a new uni year? Want to make great friends? Or have some fun and dabble in some quidditch? 

#FlyIn to our O-Week stall (#97) located on Eastern Avenue, outside the New Law Annexe and join the society! Learn about the magical sport of Quidditch (now with less magic and more tackling). You can also watch us in action at the demo game on the Quad lawns on Thursday at 1pm. https://www.facebook.com/events/968271403250981/  
We also have so many great events planned for this semester, kicking it off with our Meet-and-Greet and Hogsmeade Trip, you won't want to miss out!

The time has come to elect the 2015-16 executive for the Sydney University Quidditch Society! Our meeting will be held on 29 October 2015 (Thursday Week 13) at 5pm in Holme Meeting Room 1. 

If you would like to nominate for an executive or team committee position, please email quidditch.president@gmail.com with your name, access card number, positions you are nominating for (in order of preference) and a statement (100 words-ish) outlining why you are running. If you have any questions about a position, talk to the person who currently holds it (see below).

The University of Sydney Quidditch Society is proud to present to you, Harry Potter Trivia!

The event will be held on Tuesday the 22nd of September at 7pm at Manning Bar*.

We will be asking you to sign up as a team of 6-10 people, so start figuring out which of your friends is the biggest Potterhead! Alternatively you will be able to sign up as an individual and will be placed on a team with the other individuals.

This is your chance to prove that you know Harry (and his legacy) better than anyone else and to win great prizes in the process! Get out your beloved books and movies and start preparing!

TICKET PRICES
Society Member: $8
Non-Member with an Access Card: $12
Non-Member without an Access Card: $15

Registration will be open at 5:00, Tuesday, 15th of September.
If registering as a team only one person will need to sign up. This person will need the name, email and access number of everyone in their team.

Details on ticket payment will be provided when you register. All tickets will need to be paid for before the event.

*Manning Bar is an 18+ venue so you will need to be over 18 to attend.
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

description:
Ever played QUIDDITCH? Ever seen Quidditch? Not curious about Quidditch? 

If your answer to one of those questions is "no" then this is the right event for you!!

Here we are again at the start of a new semester and the University of Sydney Quidditch Society is inviting YOU to our welcome session for the second semester!

In this event you get to hear from our seasoned players about what it is like to play Quidditch and how do you play it. It's really not that hard and ANYONE CAN PLAY! 

Come down and join us for this welcome session to get to know us better, get to know the game better, and best, get some hands on experience after the session. 

The welcome session is followed by training so you can get straight to the hands on stuff and get over the talking part!

Hope to see you all there!

The University of Sydney Quidditch Society is proud to present to you, the Harry Potter Trivia!

The event is scheduled for 18th of May 2015, starting from 7pm, live at our very own Manning Bar.

We have had successes with our previous trivia events that we have held in the past 2 years and this year's event promises to be a big one yet again.

Featuring plastic studded comedic acts such as the team clowns from the University of Sydney Unspeakables and Unbreakables, come join us for a night of fun, laughter and joy, as we test your knowledge of the Harry Potter universe.

Go re-read all the books, re-watch all the movies and re-play all the games to prepare yourself for a night that you will never forget. (Or a night that you will forget the next morning cause that also means you had fun right?)

From all of us at the University of Sydney Quidditch Society execs, we look forward to seeing you at Manning Bar on the 18th of May 2015 at 7pm.

TICKET PRICES
Society Member: $8
Non-Member with an Access Card: $12
Non-Member without an Access Card: $15
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

description:
Right after the information session on Thursday we'll be heading down to Victoria Park so you can all try quidditch out for yourselves.
It's going to be a ton of fun with lots of different activities so anyone can try their hand at any position, all are welcome.

Welcome to the Sydney University Quidditch Society!

To get you started for the year, we are hosting a 'Welcome Information Session' on the 5th of March (Thursday) at The Loggia Room, Manning House, and 6th of March (Friday) 2015, at the Bernard Eldershaw Room, Manning House.

In this 'Welcome Information Session' we will be chatting to you about, first of all, how to play the game that we love, Quidditch.

We will go through all the basic rules you need to know about the game, and then right after, you will get to take it into practice as we head out straight to training after the information session.

During the meeting we will also be talking to you about what is going to happen within the club for the next few weeks, and you will also get an introduction to the who's who of the Quidditch Society.

http://www.usydquidditch.com/events/welcome-information-session
place: The Loggia, Manning House (5th March) & Bernard Eldershaw Room, Manning House (6th March)

event_name: Sydney Uni Quidditch Society: O WEEK!
description:
The O-Week is here and it is a chance for us to say,

"Welcome to the University of Sydney"

Over three days of festivities around the Sydney Uni grounds, we will be there in our stand waiting to welcome you to our community. You can meet members of the team and join the society! We have loads of Harry Potter themed social events throughout the year so meet our friendly team members and find out more about what we do!

And to those who are keen to play or simply want to know more about Quidditch, we also have a display game that will be happening on Wednesday, 12-1pm, 25th of February 2015, where you can watch us play a game of Quidditch to get an understanding about how it works, and then join us and play!

Come on down! We can't wait to meet you!

"Welcome to Sydney University. Now, in a few moments you will pass through these doors and join your classmates, but before you take your seats, you must be sorted into your houses. They are Ronan House, Derrick House, Wentworth House, and Nicholson House. Now while you're here, your house will be like your family. Your triumphs will earn you points. Any rule breaking, and you will lose points. At the end of the year, the house with the most points is awarded the house cup." So are the first words that most first years hear upon entering Sydney University, or they would if the Quidditch Society could have it's way.

Instead we'll have our own, later then the start of semester one, but with our own original houses created just for our peers here at Sydney University. Just like the quote indicates all those attending will be sorted into one of the four USyd houses (each one devoted to someone we wouldn't be here today, making this event, without). While lacking a magical, talking hat, we will still do our best to sort you into a house that suits you. This will lend itself to many other events where you can earn points for your house through the following year(s). Even if you don't closely follow the happenings of the Quidditch Society or anything Harry Potter, this will still prove to be a great event and we hope to see many of you there.
place: Holme Building Sydney University - Reading Room

description:
I hope you all have your forms signed and ready, because the weekend after Easter The University of Sydney Quidditch Society will be taking their very own trip into Hogsmeade from Hogwarts. If you need further clarification, this essentially means that as a group we will all head from Campus and venture into Newtown. It'll essentially be a pub crawl with the occasional miscellaneous shop thrown in for the sake of variety. 
Not only that, but it has come to our attention that many members of our teams and prominent figures in our society have they birthdays in April so it will also be a birthday celebration and drinks for many of the people there. So come along, grab a drink and join in the festivities of this Hogsmeade trip.
place: Eastern Avenue, the University of Sydney

description:
After breaking his soul up into several pieces and scattering them across the world, Voldemort has left a serious, not to mention gravely dangerous, task ahead for our Witches and Wizards. With clues, puzzles, codes and riddles hiding these Horcruxes, only the brave few will make it to the end and crush The Dark Lord's dreams of immortality and bigotry. 

So form your hunting teams and sign up for this adventure through The University of Sydney as the Quidditch Society present you with the Horcrux Hunt. 

Spread across three days with three rounds of clues to crack, you and your team can take it at your own pace throughout the days so you are able to go to classes and hunt during your breaks. Though be weary each round of clues will be up by 10:00 and taken down by 18:00 each day. When you solve a clue you will be required to send an email with the required information to usyd.quidditch.events@gmail.com to obtain points for your team, just remember to include your team name when sending the email through. At the end of the three days the team with the highest score wins!

To pick up your Diary and first clue on Monday, come find us along Eastern Avenue after ten with your team to start your adventure.

Prices are as follows: 
$3.00 for Quidditch Society Members
$4.50 for Access Holders
$6.00 for Non-Access Holders

Be you witch, wizard or muggle, come one and all to the Quidditch Society's Harry Potter Trivia night where teams will battle it out to proclaim that their knowledge of the world of Harry Potter is greatest. 

Prizes will be awarded to the two highest-scoring tables and the best dressed individual (so get those costumes out!) as well as a bonus jug of beer for the table that does best in each round.

There are a limited number of tables available so get yours registered soon (8 people to a table). Tickets are paid on the night and each one comes with a drink voucher. The prices are:

Quidditch Society Member: $8
Access Member: $12
Non-Access: $15
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

description:

Come along to the first SUMS meeting of the year!

Whether running for a position or not, everyone is encouraged to attend to support their peers and engage with their student society.

Proceedings will begin at 6pm sharp so please arrive 15 minutes early.

**TO APPLY FOR 1st YEAR REP: Please email a short (200 word) blurb outlining what you will bring to the role, along with a photo of yourself to secretary@sydneymedsoc.org.au BY 11:59PM SATURDAY 24TH FEBRUARY**

***TO APPLY FOR ALL OTHER POSITIONS: Please attend the meeting and be prepared to give a short (1 minute) speech on what you will bring to the role. If you cannot attend the meeting, email the secretary with a short (200 word) piece to be read out at the meeting on your behalf***

POSITIONS UP FOR ELECTION (in no particular order) and brief role description:

-Assistant AMSA Representative (all stages)
Assist the AMSA rep (Connor Duncan) with AMSA policy tasks, attending national council, organising Convention and the Blood Drive.

-NSW Medical Students' Council Representative (all stages)
Attending MSC meetings to discuss policy, initiatives, the cocktail party and sports day with reps from the other NSW medical schools.

-Indigenous Health Officer (all stages)
Organising “Close the Gap” day and liaising with AIDA on Indigenous issues. Attend meetings with A/Prof. Lilon Bandler.

-Sports Coordinator x2 (one stage 1, one stage 2)
Organising the sporting events throughout the year such as Med1 vs Med2 soccer, interfaculty sports, Quadfac rugby and many more. 

-Merchandise Officer (all stages)
Organise merchandise for the society - hoodies etc. You will be assisting the current Merch Officer, Tamblyn Devoy.

-Assistant Directors of Publications (all stages, up to 3)
Assisting the Director of Publications (Umaima Ahmad) with producing Innominate and Feet First. Knowledge of InDesign and editorial experience is preferred but not necessary.

-First Year Representatives (stage 1 only, up to 2)
Organise parties for your year level and report their thoughts to SUMS and faculty. Often one of the most hotly contested roles!
**TO APPLY FOR 1st YEAR REP: Please email a short (200 word) blurb outlining what you will bring to the role, along with a photo of yourself to secretary@sydneymedsoc.org.au BY 11:59PM SATURDAY 24TH FEBRUARY**

-Fourth Year Representatives (stage 3 year 3 only, up to 2)
Organise the most important event of your cohort's medical career: Graduation Ball!

-Producer of the Medicine Revue (stage 1 only)
Working with your cohort in organising MedRevue, a show that has raised tens of thousands of dollars for charity in the past. A huge job where organisational and people skills (not necessarily creative air) are key.

-Information Technology Director (all stages)
Assisting the current IT Director (Rishav Dhakal) with the nuts and bolts of the SUMS website, emailing and other services

-Senior International Student Representative (stage 3 only)
Work with the Junior Rep (Rishi Nair) and NAMSA on issues concerning international students

-Med Ball Convenors (all stages, up to 2)
Organise the fanciest SUMS event of the year! The venue has already been booked so the hard part has been done. Help us do the fun stuff.
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Please note, advertising your campaign via the SUMS platform (i.e. on cohort facebook pages) is against SUMS election policy. You are welcome to spread the word among your peers and make posts to your personal facebook, but please refrain from posting to the SUMS group pages.
------------------------------------------------------------------

description:
Notice is hereby given of the SUMS AGM for 2017.

The 2017 Executive has been honoured to serve you this year, and now it is time for us to handover to a new team for 2018. 

We encourage our members to run for positions and attend this meeting to be part of the Society Executive and Council for 2018!

Important dates:
Executive and AMSA Rep voting closes 11.59pm 9th October

Council Positions up for election can be viewed in this document: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By40vnoZ_5UxV3ZqeDZ0ZWNpSmc/view?usp=sharing

Please take the time to review the SUMS Electoral Policy: 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By40vnoZ_5UxVGNTNGx2YklHcUU/view?usp=sharing

We are delighted to announce and welcome Professor Fiona Wood AM to deliver the 59th annual Lambie Dew Oration in 2017 on 'Striving for excellence in Medicine'. 

Professor Wood is a pioneer in burns research and plastic surgery, particularly in the development of ‘Spray on Skin’. She is well known for continuously campaigning for burns medicine and through her ability to coordinate major medical response operations to worldwide traumatic events involving the treatment of burns victims such as the Bali bombings in 2002. Professor Wood was named a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) in 2003, and named Australian of the year in 2005 for her tireless contributions to Medicine in the fields of Burns research. She is also an ‘Australian National Living Treasure’. 

Now in its 59th year, the Lambie Dew Oration is an annual public event held in honour of Professors Charles Lambie and Harold Dew, the first Bosch Chairs of Medicine and Surgery at the University of Sydney. It is an opportunity for the Sydney University Medical Society (SUMS) to invite a speaker who has made a major impact in health to address an audience in the formal surroundings of the Great Hall and represents one of the key scholarly events organised by SUMS.

Please register your attendance (free) through the SUMS store here: https://store.sydneymedsoc.org.au/collections/events/products/lambie-dew-oration-2017

Light refreshments will be provided.

Thank you to Pulse by BOQ Specialist for generously sponsoring the event.
place: The Great Hall, The University of Sydney

description:
SUMS is hosting our annual Stage 3 Transition Night, a forum where  speakers from Years 3 and 4 from various backgrounds will give you the details and their insights on how Stage 3 works!

Based on an earlier poll, the schedule will be as follows:

6:00 pm: Refreshments
6:30-6:40: Talks from sponsors Pulse by BOQ Specialist and Medical Indemnity Protection Society - MIPS
6.40 - 7.00: Overview of the two years, what each term is, core blocks vs specialty blocks 
7.00 - 7.15: Introduction to the exams - barriers, core blocks, long cases, PWH osces and approach to studying
7.15 - 7.30:  "A day in the life of a Stage 3 student"
7.30 - 7.35: Short break 
7.35 - 7.50: Slav Nikolic on med school, having children and working
7.50 - 8.05: Erica Danieletto on mixing med school, work and life balance
8.05 - 8.20: What is a long case? How do they work? How do you practice? The manilla folder method
8:20 - 8:30 pm - Talks from NAMSA's Steven Campbell, specifically for international students

Our speakers will be:

KIERAN MUIR - STREAM 2/3 - ORANGE/SAN
Kieran hails from New Zealand originally but has gone under the cover for many years except when certain words sneak through. Spent the first two years at College, helped out on MedCamp in 2nd year and went out West for 3rd year to Orange. Spent his elective in South Africa, Nepal and New Zealand. Was involved with Convention during 4th Year and thinks he knows how to master the attendance and sign-off system quite well now. Kieran will be giving an overview to Stage 3 and discussing long case technique and the infamous manilla folder technique. 

EMMA SHEAVES - STREAM 3 - NORTHERN
Emma was previously a physiotherapist and has an avid interest in rural health, primary care (general practice and emergency medicine). Constantly at the top of the year for assessments and balances that with work and a number of other interests. Her stage 3 Core Terms were neurology/endocrinology (med 3), general surgery/orthopaedics (Lismore), critical care (RNSH), general practice /cardiology (med 4). She’ll be coming along to discuss stage 3 assessments, tips on study methods, exam information, and a general overview of stream 3. 

EMMA CUMMING - STREAM 4 - NEPEAN
Emma went to Lismore for year 3 and so is now an expert in shark attacks, Nimbin alterative medicine and whale watching. Emma will be discussing a typical week and ‘Day in the life of a Stage 3’ and her strategies on how to maintain the all important work/life balance. She’ll also be touching on where to live, study tips, organising a useful study group, endless podcasts, electives, MD project and many, many more topcis. 

SLAV NIKOLIC - STREAM 3 - WESTMEAD
Before med school Slav studied Exercise and Sports Science and then Physiotherapy, both at Sydney Uni (Cumberland Campus). Clearly a sucker for punishment, he followed the two degrees with Medicine. He has worked as a Physio at Westmead Hospital for 6 years and during med school has continued to work part time as a Physio on weekends. Slav is married and has two adorable children. Luka aged 4 years and Rafael aged 5 months (barrier exams with a 5-month-old…). Slav will be discussing a work/life/kid balance during Med School as well as some sage tips for the year. 

ERICA DANIELETTO - STREAM 3 - CONCORD
Erica hails from the least involved clinical school (Concord) and her med philosophy of flying under the radar means she also answers to Erin and Emma, so that will make remembering names on transition night even easier! Coming from a non-science background she can't tell you much about med, so instead she'll be talking about how awesome stream 3 is, being a secretarial mastermind, and bringing home the bacon. Her talk will cover how to be super organised with forms and other modules (eg. PPD, PopMed, Indigenous health, ophthal logbook) and working part-time during stage 3.

Thank you to our speakers for taking the time out to talk to us, and please come armed with all the questions you ever wanted to ask about Stage 3!

Look forward to seeing you there!

Thank you to our sponsors, Pulse by BOQ Specialist and Medical Indemnity Protection Society - MIPS for making this night possible.

event_name: SUMS BLUE Party: All Profits for BeyondBlue
description:
Earlier this month, SUMS closed the mental health survey after receiving over 380 responses from all four years of students. As part of the results, 15% of students reported currently suffering from a mental illness diagnosed by a psychiatrist and 19% have been diagnosed in the past. 

51% of students also reported having seen a professional for mental health issues in the past. 

What does this mean? Having a mental health issue doesn’t mean you’re more vulnerable or alone, and possessing resilience is only a small part of the solution in a difficult and competitive culture and working environment.

We know there’s much more to change and raising awareness is only the beginning, but we’re proud to present SUMS’ first ever Blue Party, an initiative started by AMSA Mental Health. All four years and external guests are invited, with activities, free food on the night, and most importantly, all profits going towards BeyondBlue. Make sure to get tickets soon because this will celebrate the end of blocks and terms for all four years, and capacity is limited!

Where: Altitude Bar, Shelbourne Hotel
When: Friday 22nd September, 7 pm-midnight, last entry at 9 pm
What to wear: At least one thing should be blue, as should be all donations ;)
Tickets: $15 each or 5 for $60: https://store.sydneymedsoc.org.au/collections/events/products/sums-blue-party?variant=42351349458

Looking forward to seeing you there!

Our second meeting of the year is coming up!

All members are encouraged to attend to hear reports from the Executive and Council members on the activity of the society.

Proceedings will start at 6pm sharp so please arrive 15 minutes early.

Agenda: https://goo.gl/3xtWVj

description:
Feeling stressed about the upcoming exams? 

Desperately need a cuddle buddy?

...SUMS is excited to announce that we will bringing a PETTING ZOO to USYD! 

Come to the lawns just outside Footbridge next Friday to cuddle a rabbit, baby chick or duck, or hand/bottle feed a calf, piglet, sheep, lamb or goat. 

We will encourage a gold coin donation but mainly this event is to encourage a bit of much needed stress relief and catch-up time with friends before exams, as part of SUMS Mental Health Month.

Make sure to invite your friends and see you there! :)

event_name: SUMS Seminar: Mental Health of Young Doctors
description:
Have you wondered, given the current media attention, what the state of the mental health of junior doctors is really like?

What does the future look like for support for medical students and doctors? 

What resources can we receive now, and what is being done?

The state of mental health among doctors has come under a spotlight as we reach a crucial tipping point in the need for a culture change and increased support. This is one of the most important issues we may face as young doctors. As part of SUMS' Mental Health Month, please come along to hear our guest speakers discuss their take on these issues.

Food will be provided from 4:30 - 5 pm, which is available thanks to our sponsors Medical Indemnity Protection Society - MIPS.

Our speakers include:

A/Prof Carmelle Peisah – Psychiatrist, Clinical Associate Professor at Sydney University and conjoint Professor at UNSW; 30 years expertise in student and doctor welfare with numerous publications and presentations in this area and independent board nominated assessor for former NSW Medical Board Impaired Registrants Programme. 

Dr Bethan Richards – Head of Rheumatology at RPA, former RPA director of physician’s training and winner of the AMA’s award for Teacher of the Year in 2016. Developer of the Basic Physician Training-OK (BPT-OK) program at RPA for doctors in their first year of training for introduction of skills for mental and physical wellbeing.

If you have a specific question to ask a speaker, please email vpevents@sydneymedsoc.org.au

Please RSVP by clicking attending on this event and look forward to seeing you there.

event_name: SUMS Mental Health Month of May
description:
WHAT'S ON:

Friday 26th May, 12-2 pm outside Footbridge: SUMS Petting Zoo
https://www.facebook.com/events/1826504737669568

___

We know that every day, medical students and trainees are put under a lot of pressure, whether it’s keeping up with classes and studying for exams or putting in long, demanding hours at hospital. This is on top of other pressures we may need to balance like part-time work and finances, relationships, family and more. However, looking after our own mental health and wellbeing is just as important as our physical wellbeing or the wellbeing of patients.

SUMS hopes that in this month of May, we can place a greater focus on increasing the dialogue surrounding mental health, to be able to reach out to our peers, feel encouraged to seek help and support if we need, and to reduce the stigma surrounding mental illness.

Please be on the lookout for educational and fun events in May which will be announced on this page!
 
____


Free and confidential counselling is available at university through: Counselling and Psychological Services (CAPS)
Phone: +61 2 8627 8433  or +61 2 8627 8437
Email: caps.admin@sydney.edu.au
cumberland.cs@sydney.edu.au

NSW Local Health District Mental Health Line: 1800 011 511
Lifeline (24 hours): 13 11 14
 
If you would like to talk to SUMS about any feedback or ideas for events, email vpevents@sydneymedsoc.org.au or healthandwellbeing@sydneymedsoc.org.au

SUMS students, be brave and shave!

As medical students, we see firsthand the impact that leukaemias, lymphomas and myelomas can have on people’s lives. Though shaving or colouring hair may be temporary, the money raised and the impact it can have in improving someone’s life is not. That is why SUMS is proud to announce we will again be hosting a World’s Greatest Shave event at the Grandstand this year. The money raised for the Leukaemia Foundation will provide direct support to people living with blood cancers or help fund vital research as we get closer to becoming fully fledged doctors! 

In the lead up to the day, make sure to show your support and donate, and on the night, watch as your fellow medical students shave, colour or wax their hair for a great cause. You can also participate in our raffle on the night for a chance to win some great prizes as well. Or better yet, get involved and simply sign up at tinyurl.com/SUMSshaves to start your own journey! There will be a $100 voucher kindly donated by the Grandstand for the student who raises the most money.

A big thank you to our generous sponsors:
- The Grandstand Sydney Uni for the venue and gift voucher
- Noddys on King Hairdressers for donating their time to do the shaves and raffle vouchers
- Ralph's Cafe at Sydney University and Forest Lodge Hotel for donating raffle vouchers

Forest Lodge Hotel is also the official afterparty venue!

See you there, and keep your eyes peeled for more announcements closer to the date!

description:

Whether running for a position or not, everyone is encouraged to attend to support their peers and engage with their student society.

Proceedings will begin at 6pm sharp so please arrive 15 minutes early.

POSITIONS UP FOR ELECTION and brief role description:

-Assistant Medical Education Officer
Assist the MEO (James Curchin)

-Assistant AMSA Representative
Assist the AMSA rep (Alex Yip) with AMSA policy tasks, attending national council, organising Convention and the Blood Drive.

-NSW Medical Students' Council Representative
Attending MSC meetings to discuss policy, initiatives, the cocktail party and sports day with reps from the other NSW medical schools.

-Indigenous Health Officer
Organising “Close the Gap” day and liaising with AIDA on Indigenous issues. Attend meetings with A/Prof. Lilon Bandler.

-Sports Coordinator x2 (one stage 1, one stage 2)
Organising the sporting events throughout the year such as Med1 vs Med2 soccer, interfaculty sports, Quadfac rugby and many more. 

-Merchandise Officer
Organise merchandise for the society - hoodies etc

-Assistant Directors of Publications (up to 3)
Assisting the Director of Publications (Rachael O’Reilly) with producing Innominate and Feet First. Knowledge of InDesign and editorial experience is preferred but not necessary.

-First Year Representatives (up to 2)
Organise parties for your year level and report their thoughts to SUMS and faculty. Often one of the most hotly contested roles!
**TO APPLY FOR 1st YEAR REP: Please email a short (200 word) blurb outlining what you will bring to the role, along with a photo of yourself to secretary@sydneymedsoc.org.au BY 11:59PM SATURDAY 4TH MARCH**

-Third Year Representatives (up to 2)
Organise casual get togethers at the end of terms, report feedback from cohort to faculty.

-Producer of the Medicine Revue
Working with your cohort in organising MedRevue, a show that has raised tens of thousands of dollars for charity in the past. A huge job where organisational and people skills (not necessarily creative air) are key.

-Information Technology Director
Assisting the current IT Director (Alexander To) with the nuts and bolts of the SUMS website, emailing and other services

-Senior International Student Representative (Stage 3 only)
Work with the Junior Rep (Rishi Nair) and NAMSA on issues concerning international students

-Halfway Graduation Ball convenors (2)
Organise a ball for the end of Stage 2

------------------------------------------------------------------

**TO APPLY FOR 1st YEAR REP: Please email a short (200 word) blurb outlining what you will bring to the role, along with a photo of yourself to secretary@sydneymedsoc.org.au BY 11:59PM SATURDAY 4TH MARCH**

***TO APPLY FOR ALL OTHER POSITIONS: Please attend the meeting and be prepared to give a short (1 minute) speech on what you will bring to the role. If you cannot attend the meeting, email the secretary with a short (200 word) piece to be read out at the meeting on your behalf***

------------------------------------------------------------------
Please note, advertising your campaign via the SUMS platform (i.e. on cohort facebook pages) is against SUMS election policy. You are welcome to spread the word among your peers and make posts to your personal facebook, but please refrain from posting to the SUMS group pages. 
------------------------------------------------------------------

event_name: SUMS Presents: 58th Annual Lambie Dew Oration
description:
SUMS is delighted to welcome Professor Gordian Fulde to deliver the 58th annual Lambie Dew Oration in 2016. 

Professor Fulde is the Director of the Emergency at St Vincent’s Hospital and Sydney Hospital, and the 2016 Senior Australian of the Year. Among his many achievements, Professor Fulde is the longest serving Emergency Department Director in a major hospital in Australia, having served in this role for more than three decades. 

Now in its 58th year, the Lambie Dew Oration is an annual public event held in honour of Professors Charles Lambie and Harold Dew, the first Bosch Chairs of Medicine and Surgery at the University of Sydney. It is an opportunity for the Sydney University Medical Society (SUMS) to invite a speaker who has made a major impact in health to address an audience in the formal surroundings of the Great Hall and represents one of the key scholarly events organised by SUMS.

More information about our speaker and the history of the Oration can be found at http://sydneymedsoc.wixsite.com/lambie-dew. This is a free event, but attendees will be required to register their attendance at https://goo.gl/forms/6i9EYNpQUs48MUkb2 for catering purposes.

We look forward to seeing you there!

event_name: The 2015 Lambie Dew Oration: Fran Baum, on Creating Healthy and Fair Communities
description:
The Lambie Dew Oration is an annual event held by the Sydney University Medical Society, for an eminent speaker in the field of health to address the Sydney Medical School community. We are delighted to announce that the speaker for the 57th Lambie Dew Oration is Professor Fran Baum, Matthew Flinders Distinguished Professor of Public Health and one of Australia's leading researchers on the social and economic determinants of health. 

Professor Baum will present an Oration to address the changing face of health equity as we move into an increasingly technological age of medicine with an increasing emphasis on personalised care. Challenges of balancing advances in medical care with equality of outcomes are already upon us, and likely to become more dramatic as new technology is developed. Professor Baum will challenge us to consider these issues head on, and consider the role of population health and medical professionals in promoting and advocating for health equity.

We look forward to having Professor Baum deliver a challenging and surely unforgettable Oration. 

This is a free and public event, however seats are limited so please register your attendance by visiting this link: 

https://www.eventbrite.com.au/e/lambie-dew-oration-2015-fran-baum-on-creating-healthy-and-fair-communities-registration-18431996598

Your 2015 Lambie Dew Convenors, 
Diana Cavaye, James Newman and Andy Wallace
place: The Great Hall, The University of Sydney

description:
HOW ON EARTH DOES STAGE 3 WORK AHHDNSIHNTODYJDJERHAGOD?!?

If you have ever had this thought, then this event is for you. 

 SUMS is hosting a forum with 4 Stage 3 students providing their insight into how best to understand the format and layout of years 3 and 4, the most effective study and learning techniques to balance the increased work load, and an overview of assessment structure, content, and timetabling.

The best way to cut through all the nonsense is to hear it from students who've gone through it all before you! The transition from basic sciences to full-time clinical teaching can be a stressful and demanding time for everyone, so our speakers will share with you how they have managed to survive!

There will be loads of time for #QANDA as well, so be as nerdy and picky as you like with your questions! AND because our fourth years will be away on elective when we start, we'll be all alone when we start - so ask now! 

Dips and bread will be provided en masse... Obviously.

event_name: R U OK? Day at Sydney Medical School
description:
We spend A LOT of time together as medical students. So we're in a good position to look out for one another, especially if one of our peers is struggling. 

They might be acting a bit differently -  seem to have a lot on their plate, missing class or simply don't seem themselves. Don’t ignore those signs - but instead take some time to start a conversation and ask “Are you OK?”

 R U OK? Day is a national day of action and dedicated to reminding people to regularly check in with family and friends. R U OK? Day is organised by The R U OK? Foundation, a not-for-profit organisation dedicated to encouraging all people to regularly and meaningfully ask 'Are you ok?' to support those struggling with life.

The aim of the SUMS RUOK? day is to foster an environment where medical students are looking out for each other and feel prepared and comfortable enough to start up a conversation.The RUOK organisation has put together some practical tips on how to start a conversation with someone who you think is struggling:
https://ruok.org.au/how-to-ask

We'll be hosting RUOK day on Friday 11th of September, and encourage you all to wear YELLOW to promote the day. 
We'll have a BBQ at the quad fac rugby and touch football so come down to Johns oval after classes on Friday and hang out with your fellow medical student and cheer on our teams (yelling is a great stress reliever, as is sport!)

The men’s rugby team is playing at 6pm and the women’s touch football team is playing at 7:10. Both teams will be wearing yellow armbands to support the day.

Emma Cumming
SUMS Health and Wellbeing Officer

*National RUOK day is the day prior, on Thursday 10th of September (https://www.facebook.com/events/974429872571875/)

As part of the ongoing SUMS academic program, the next seminar will focus on Block 3: Respiratory Sciences.

The aim of these talks is to provide a "mini-masterclass" after each block, along with a forum for any lingering questions that may not have been answered in the teaching weeks. We will be inviting a clinician or senior student to give a small introductory lecture on a particularly important or complicated aspect of the topic, then they will answer general questions that students have submitted beforehand and/or from the floor.

Next up is respiratory - one of the most common and fundamental areas of clinical medicine, particularly for young doctors. The talk is aimed at Stage 1, but students from any stage and background are of course welcome and encouraged to attend. Our speaker is Praveenan Sivabalan, a medical registrar at Royal Prince Alfred Hospital. Praveenan's talk will focus on the most clinically important respiratory disorders and will work through specific cases.

Please submit any questions you have for Praveenan to meo@sydneymedsoc.org.au by this Monday evening (03/08/15).
