description:
Once again GlobalHome and the Sydney University Medical Society will be combining forces to bring you… THE RED PARTY. 

Medical students will be celebrating the end of blocks 2 and 7, and all other health and medical science students are invited to celebrate the end of Semester 1 by raising funds and awareness for HIV and AIDS.

And you’ll have to look your best, because this year the theme is:

***RED CARPET***

Come dressed in something nice with a splash of red.

Every year, medical students from around the country band together to raise funds and awareness, so that university students may engage with the issues surrounding HIV and AIDS, particularly in the developing world. The Red Party will form part of our Red Week, which will also include a seminar on these topics, and a bake sale to raise further funds towards our chosen charity.

The Red Party is a charity event and all money from ticket sales will go towards the Global Aids Interfaith Alliance (http://www.thegaia.org/), a non-profit NGO that provides basic preventative health services, care and support in communities affected by HIV, AIDS, TB and malaria in Malawi.

Tickets will be $10 beforehand, or $15 on the door. Get in early to avoid disappointment.

Medical students have some of the highest rates of depression and anxiety amongst university students. As a student cohort, and indeed as a profession, open and frank discussion of mental health still has a perverse stigma associated with it - a tough it out attitude -  to the detriment of the many students struggling with this burden. 

In light of this, and as part of the Health & Wellbeing Program run by SUMS, we would like to invite you to our Inaugural Mental Health Forum. This is an opportunity to raise the issues involved with coping with, and talking about, mental health, in a safe and meaningful manner.

Four medical students in the Sydney Medical Program have kindly and bravely offered to share their experiences with us - in order to get a better sense of how one deals with these issues, and the kind of support services available whilst at university. This will be a safe space for discussion, and we request respect and discretion at all times - attendees are encouraged to ask questions of our speakers, and offer their own experiences if they would like to. 

VENUE: Seminar Room, the Quarter (the new Postgraduate-only Library space)

TIME: 6:30-7:30pm, snacks from 6pm - Thursday 18th June

Welcome to MedBall 2015 - the premier social event of the Sydney University Medical Society - SUMS calendar. Every year, the standard is set exceptionally high - and 2015 will be no exception. 

Come May 23rd, prepare to be whisked away from ordinary, to experience a magical (perhaps, romantic?) evening at the Four Seasons Hotel in The Rocks - it's Midnight in Paris. 

Drop the pens, and let your hair down to celebrate with friends and partners - tickets will be on sale Monday April 27th at 5pm!

For any questions, please contact the 2015 MedBall Convenors - Saraya and Eloise - at medball@sydneymedsoc.org.au

http://www.medball2015.com/

event_name: SUMS Seminar Series - B is for B-Cell: Immunology
description:
As part of the ongoing SUMS academic program, the second of the year’s seminar’s will focus on Block 1: Immunology and Infection.

The aim of these talks is to provide a "mini-masterclass" after each block, along with a forum for any lingering questions that may not have been answered in the teaching weeks. We will be inviting a clinician or senior student to give a small introductory lecture on a particularly important or complicated aspect of the topic, then they will answer general questions that students have submitted beforehand and/or from the floor.

Next up is immunology, a topic that is often poorly understood in the first few years of the degree. The talk is aimed at Stage 1, particularly those without a science background, but students from any stage and background are of course welcome and encouraged to attend. Our speaker is Nick Meyer, a Stage 3 medical student with a Science (Adv) (Hons) degree in immunology. Nick’s talk will focus on breaking down the topic of immunology to first principles and fundamentals, and building up a framework to work from in the future. The talk will be focused on the basic physiology of the immune system, rather than any clinical applications.

Light refreshments will be provided.

Please submit your questions to meo@sydneymedsoc.org.au by this Sunday evening (11/05/15).

SUMS x
place: Level 6 Seminar Room, Charles Perkins Centre, Sydney University

description:
As part of the SUMs academic program, the first of the year’s seminar series  will focus on Block 6: Neurosciences. 

The aims of these talks is to provide a "mini-masterclass" after each block, along with a forum for any lingering questions that may not have been answered in the teaching weeks. We will be inviting a clinician or senior student to give a small introductory lecture on a particularly important or complicated aspect of the topic, then they will answer general questions that students have submitted beforehand and/or from the floor.

First up is Neurology, just in time for Stage 2's RSA. Stage 1 and Stage 3 are of course welcome and encouraged to attend as well. Our guest is Royal Prince Alfred Neurology Advanced Trainee Dr. Justin Garber.

Light refreshments will be provided.

Please submit your questions to vpeducation@sydneymedsoc.org.au by this Monday evening (04/05/15). To clarify, they can be anything neuro-related.

We are hoping these will become a regular event on the SUMS calendar, so we'd love to get as many people there as possible and see what you think!

SUMS x
place: Kerry Packer Auditorium, Room 4.1 KPEC Building at Royal Prince Alfred

event_name: Sydney University Medical Society General Meeting
description:
Notice is hereby given for a general meeting of the Sydney University Medical Society, to be held at 6pm on Wednesday October 29th in the Teacher's College Lecture Theatre 448.

This will be the final meeting of the Society for 2014. In accordance with this year's constitutional amendments, the event convenor selection committee will move motions that the Society endorse event teams for 2015. In addition, the following positions need to be elected for the 2015 term:

President
Vice President (Advocacy)
Vice President (Events)
Treasurer
Secretary
AMSA Representative
Medical Education Officer
Director of Publications
up to two (2) Sponsorship Officers
up to two (2) Information Technology Directors
Senior International Student Representative (third or fourth year student)
Health and Wellbeing Officer
Policy Officer
up to two (2) Fourth Year Representatives
up to two (2) Third Year Representatives
up to two (2) Second Year Representatives

Voting for the 5 executive positions, and AMSA Representative, will be conducted online. Commencing immediately, members can nominate themselves for these positions. Candidates should email a headshot and a maximum 400 (executive) or 200 (AMSA Rep) word submission to president@sydneymedsoc.org.au before 5pm Saturday October 18th, when nominations will close. Online voting will be open to all members through the society website on Monday October 20th, and close on Tuesday 28th October at 5pm. The results will be announced at the meeting. All other positions will be elected in person at the meeting.

All questions should be directed to president@sydneymedsoc.org.au.

Want to get involved in MedSoc? The SUMS Annual General Meeting (AGM) is the place to do it. 

Come along for some free pizza and drinks from 6:00pm and the meeting will start at 6:30pm sharp. Nominations will be taken from the floor on the night

The positions up for grabs at next AGM are: 
a.	Electoral Officer (1)
b.	Producer of the Medical Revue (1) 
c.	First Year Representatives (up to 2)
d.	IT Officer (1)
d.	Sport and Wellbeing Directors (up to 3 comprising at least one first year student and one second year student)
e.	Assistant Medical Education Officer (1)
f.	Assistant AMSA Representative (1)
g.	Assistant Sponsorship Coordinator (1)
h.	Assistant Directors of Publications (up to 3)
i.	Assistant Secretary (1) 
j.	Rural Health Officer (1)
k.	Indigenous Health Officer (1)
l.	? Asst Indigenous Health Officer (1)
m.	MSC (Medical Students’ Council) Representative (1)
n.	AMA (Australian Medical Association) (NSW) Representative (1)
o.	Junior International Students’ Representative (1)
p.	Media Officer (1)
q.	Director of the Yearbook (1)
place: Professorial Board Room, The Quad, University of Sydney

description:
SHADES is taking over this Wednesday for a very merry end of semester Birdcage UNI BASH. What does that mean exactly? STUDENT RUN FUN, SPEED FRIENDING, BURLESQUE, COMEDY, BANGERS. 

The fight for equality is definitely not over yet, but kick off your shoes & live a little. You deserve it. 

We invite our comrades from across UNSW, to UTS and Macquarie to come mingle in this melting pot of Queer University goo. Door price is $5 and 50% of the proceeds will go to Twenty10!

Show us your University card and you'll go into the draw to win some kinky and queer prizes that are yet to be disclosed. 

WHAT:
8pm - 9:15pm - Speed Friending
9:15pm - 10:00pm - Burlesque, standup comedy and performances
10:00pm - Booze, babes, bangers
3am - Kick it to your new lover's place

PERFORMERS
- BLAKE LAWRENCE 
- DOLLY DAGGER
- SHEVVI BARRETT-BROWN

DJS
- CUNNINGPANTS
- ASTRIX LITTLE
- T-REX

In another embarrassing blunder by the most conservative, fun police, culture killing administration we've seen, the university has gone ahead and painted over incredibly important queer and cultural art.

**PAINT AND BRUSHES WILL BE PROVIDED**

From the curator Lucy Le Masurier:

So the conservative donkeys at USYD have taken down the incredible mural by Samuel Leighton-Dore from our Queer Attack tunnel for Verge Festival. Although unsurprising given the lack of support the university has given the arts, this is also a censorship of our queerness, our identities, and our love. 

The point of this work, and all the works in the tunnel, was to provide Queer and LGBT+ awareness. Even more so it was about visibility of our bodies and our experiences. The erasure of Sam’s work speaks volumes to the level of acceptance around our LGBT+ identities. We tried to create a Queer space to last for FIVE days, and on the SECOND day it gets taken down because some old walnut clutched their pearls a little too vigorously. 

To them I say: 

Dear Walnut(s), consider your outrage: you erased a cartoon of love and equality. You censored a scene embracing of body and gender diversity. The fact that a cartoon of queer love could be deemed offensive to the point of censorship is so typical of our political state at the moment, that I have to laugh. Because it’s laugh or cry. I hope your knee jerk reaction of 'disgust' over our Queer love-in leaves you sleepless, because your actions speak hateful volumes to our community.

We meant nothing but good from this mural, this tunnel, and this space. Huge love to everyone positively involved and the rest of our community. You're all angels xxxx

event_name: Shades Glitter Gala Pre-party - Verge Festival Feat. Nic Kelly
description:
Hi SHADES members, friends and allies from other Universities and the outside world. Join us at Courtyard for a fat ass bar tab and free food*. 

We are all headed to the USU's Annual Glitter Gala, which is a celebration of pride of campus. But mostly, there is unlimited drinks. Yes, unlimited, bottomless, drinks. Buy your tickets here and join us - https://usuglittergala2017.eventbrite.com.au/ 

We will also be holding a pre-drinks at Courtyard Bar inconjuction with Verge Festival. If you are a little shy and want to come along to Glitter Gala, but again, don't have anyone to go with, never fret. We're here!  Join us at pres to settle into a fun night!

There will be hot hot hot hot DJ's there just for us! 

Members: Free
Access: Free
Ticket holders: Free
No Access: $6 (if you want in on the bar tab)
General Public $10 (if you want in on the bar tab)

description:

description:
SHADES IS BACK BABY! The exec is bigger, better and more excited than ever, we are promising you great events and hot parties both on and off campus to bring the SHADES back to it's former glory. 

******

Are you new to campus? New to the scene? Still dragging your kinda boring super hetero friends around with you to queer events? Looking for new pals to be extra extra with?

Come to Speed Friending and find yourself a cute new crew to spend Sunday's with at the Marrickville Markets and trudge home with after a night at Heaps Gay or the Red Rattler. 

How does it work? 

LEAVE IT ALL TO US. Bring you and your entire self, as is. We'll sit you down in front of someone and you'll have 5 minutes to chat. There will be conversation prompts if you're at a total loss for words.

WHAT: Free drinks, free food, new friends
WHEN: Wednesday the 30th of August, 5 - 9pm (kick ons at Birdcage ifyou're up for it!)

Access/Members: $FREE
USYD Non-access: $5
UTS/Mac/UNSW/Other: $6

(Accessible non-access usyd student: c-link healthcare card holders - donation)

Don't have anyone to bring with you, or too shy? PM us directly and we'll set you up with someone on the exec to ease you into the evening.

RSVP here: https://goo.gl/forms/8nmDfDST8suNyE0M2

What seemed like an endless summer break has, in fact, come to an end, Trump is in the White House, Hanson and her minions seem to be multiplying at an alarming rate and, according to the Government, renewable energy is apparently ruining literally everything. 

In spite of this, SHADES knows the only way forward: celebrating the veritable END OF THE WORLD. 

Post-apocalyptic, post-Mardi Gras and Trumpian zombies of all shapes and sizes are invited to descend into the bowels of Tokyo Sing Song's hellfire and brimstone for one evening only. 

9pm, Friday 17 March (Week 2)
Tokyo Sing Song, Newtown 
FREE ENTRY
$5 HOUSE SPIRITS, BEER AND WINE FROM 9PM-10PM

HO, HO, HO! It's everyone's favourite time of year: Queer Christmas, a.k.a. Mardi Gras! 

Don your dodgy Christmas sweater, reindeer antlers, or the papier maché snowflake costume that you made for your Year 6 textiles project to kick off OWeek and the beginning of Mardi Gras with SHADES at The Burdekin. 

$5 ENTRY 
$5 HOUSE BEER, WINE, SPIRITS / $8 VODKA REDBULLS ALL NIGHT
FREE DRINKS FOR BEST COSTUMES 
DJs ON BOTH FLOORS 

FEATURING WYLDSTYLE, CUNNINGPANTS, PRIMAK, KOREBI, MATTY BIXX AND SVEN 

See you at Queer Christmas!

Come along to Queer Beers to meet lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, intersex, queer and questioning people at the University of Sydney!

We'll be sharing jugs and chatting about things like SHADES parties for queers and allies, Queer Revue, Queer Action Collective and what it's like to be queer on campus.

FREE for ACCESS card holders / $2 non-ACCESS 

USU supports responsible drinking

Be sure to also hit up the SHADES stall at OWeek to get yourself some ~sweet sweet merchandise~ and kick on with us that night at SHADES does QUEER CHRISTMAS for Mardi Gras! Check it out here: https://www.facebook.com/events/744277012403715/

BIRDCAGE x SHADES FUNDRAISER!! 

WHEN: Wed 23 Nov, 9pm-3am
WHERE: SLYFOX
WHO: Cunningpants , Mowgli May, James Smithers & Surprise Guests!

Come celebrate the end of exams and the uni year as we party with Sydney University S H ▲ D E S to fundraise for Inner City Legal Centre's Special Medical Procedures program, which helps trans teens through the courts to gain access to hormone treatment and top surgery!

We are incredibly proud to say that a percentage of bar proceeds of this event will be donated to this wonderful cause!

ICLC is the NSW-wide LGBTIQ legal service, they also run the Sex Worker Legal Service, as well as the Safe Relationships Project, which supports LGBTIQ people experiencing or escaping domestic violence. Come dance, drink and be merry for a good cause! 

Good Vibes | Friendly Faces | Sly Fox Hotel | LBGTQIA | Free Entry

event_name: Radical Sex and Consent Closing Night Party
description:
SHADES and the USU present the RADSEX Closing Night Party. We are ending this festival off with a bang! Come join us for a night of music and madness. It’s time to embrace and celebrate diverse sexualities and body positivity. 

Entry is FREE, however, we will be taking gold coin donations at the door that will be going towards Headspace! 

With a free drink for the first 250 ACCESS cardholders through the door, get ready to party from 8pm till late!

Including DJ sets from the enigmatic Yung Pliny & Wyldstyle (Girlthing, Birdcage, SHADES), live performance from USYD Band Comp WINNERS Dweeb City, as well as the ever the vivacious Toxique Haze - this is sure to be a party you won’t want to miss!


18+ Event, ID’s will be checked at the door. 

NOTE: We would like to acknowledge that in many cases consent is negated by the presence of alcohol, and that the purpose of this party is to celebrate the conclusion of Radical Sex & Consent week, and the achievements made during the week, rather than provide an opportunity for people’s consent to be violated. To that end, it is a party intended to celebrate and respect each other’s bodies. We intend for it to be a safe space for people to enjoy themselves, drink if they wish, and not to have to worry about having their consent violated. So often in party spaces people’s consent is ignored (often with the excuse of the way they were dancing, dressed, or otherwise appearing), but we hope that the festival will educate people on the severity of how wrong this is, and celebrate that education by practicing it at the party.
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

description:
Semester 2 is calling you back, but luckily SHADES is back 2 and we are bringing the beat. It’s time to wrap up in black for the Midnight Shift and back it up on the dance floor. It’s midnight, it’s leather, it’s black holes, it’s mystery. We are partying on Friday 07/08 from 9pm for $10. Conspiracy theorists will say this means something but we’d prefer not to comment. #gayagenda 

Tickets at the door or online if you are hi-tek. 

‘Look back, and smile on perils past.’ – 
Sir Walter Scott 

‘There are also all these people in crazy sunglasses, warehouses with sick parties where all the girls are covered in spikes and black leather. It's a very weird place.’ – 
Grimes

The Sydney University Dramatic Society, The University of Sydney Union & The Forest Lodge Hotel Present : A Midsummer Night's Dream.

SHADES is attending this production because it has been directed to explore same sex couples. Look, their names have been changed: 

Helios. Demetrius. Hermia. Lysander.

Four lovers flee into the forest, away from their parents and a society that says they can't be together. As bonds are broken, family and friendship are shown to be as flawed as the standards they are built on. Family can be escaped, can values?

Promocode: MidsummerMates for $15 tickets! 

Thursday Night: We will grab a feed at The Forest Lodge Hotel and then kick on to the theatre and then kick on to Oxford st.
street: Corner City Road and Cleveland Street, Chippendale

description:
Ever wanted to get involved with the hippest society on campus? Have some awesome ideas for events or want to shape the society going forward? Work with some awesome people and help your rise to the coveted BNOC status? or maybe you're just a lover of democracy? Well do we have the event for you!

On the 27th May SHADES will be holding our Annual General Meeting to elect new executive members for the following year as well as some very exciting administration matters such as annual reports and passing some mandatory constitutional amendments! Yay!

Come along and help us reach quorum and exercise your democratic rights! 

See you there! xx


If you are interested in running and want any more information or have queries either message the SHADES page on Facebook or send an email to president@shades.org.au! 

~IMPORTANT INFO~

NOMINATIONS AND VOTING
Only current SHADES members are allowed to nominate and vote for executive positions at the AGM. If you wish to do either of these and are not a current member, please see important membership information below. To nominate for a position you must send an email with your name, Access ID and position(s) which you are nominating for to president@shades.org.au. Nominations are open from now until 24 hours before the AGM, that is 5pm on Tuesday the 26th of May. NO NOMINATIONS WILL BE TAKEN ON THE FLOOR. The ballot will be conducted using first past the post voting.

MEMBERSHIP
To nominate yourself and/or vote in the AGM you must be a current SHADES member. As per our constitution no new members are to be signed up 7 days before the AGM. So the deadline to sign up as a member to vote or nominate is midnight Tuesday 19th of May. If you wish to become a member please email your name and Access ID to president@shades.org.au, membership is $6 which you will need to pay be on the night of the AGM if you wish to sign up now.

AGENDA
AGENDA OF A GENERAL MEETING OF SHADES TO BE HELD AT 5PM ON 27/5/15 IN THE Holme Common Room. 

1.	OPENING AND WELCOME
2.	APOLOGIES AND LEAVES OF ABSENCE
3.	MINUTES OF THE PREVIOUS MEETING i. Minutes of the meeting will be considered.
4.	BUSINESS ARISING FROM THE MINUTES
5.	CORRESPONDENCE i. Incoming and outgoing correspondence since the previous meeting of the Society will be circulated.
6.	MOTIONS ON NOTICE 
Add 2.1
“The Society” is not for profit; meaning: the assets and income of the society shall be applied solely in furtherance of the aims of the society and no portion shall be distributed directly or indirectly to the members of the society except as bona fide compensation expenses incurred on behalf of the society.

i.   Amend 7.3 to read
Except as provided in Clause 9, the Secretary shall give at least seven (7) clear days notice of the time and place of a General Meeting through one of the recognized publications of the University of Sydney Union and, if possible, the Society notice board and, if possible, by a mail-out to all members. (A mail-out is understood to include communication by e-mail.)

ii.    Amend 7.4 to read
Quorum at General Meetings shall be the lesser of one-third of the Ordinary Members or fifteen (15) Ordinary Members. If within thirty minutes from the time appointed for the meeting a quorum is not present, the meeting shall be dissolved.

iii.    Amend 8.3 to read
The Secretary shall give at least fourteen (14) clear days notice of the time and place of the Annual General Meeting in one of the recognised publications of the University of Sydney Union and, if possible, the Society notice board and, if possible, by a mail-out to all members. (A mail-out is understood to include communication by e-mail.)

iv.    Amend 9.4 to read
The Secretary shall give at least fourteen (14) clear days notice of the time and place of the annual elections in one of the recognised publications of the University of Sydney Union and, if possible, the Society notice board and, if possible, by a mailout to all members. (A mail-out is understood to include communication by email.) The notice shall state:
     i) the day on which nominations open, which day shall be at least fourteen (14) clear days before the day of the elections;
     ii) the day and time on which nominations close, which shall be no later than the time of the meeting at which the elections are to occur;
    iii) the time, date and venue of the election;
     iv) that only Ordinary Members, and Honorary Members who would otherwise be eligible for Ordinary Membership, shall be eligible to be candidates for election or to vote.

v.    Amend 9.7 to read
The Clubs and Societies Manager shall serve as Electoral Arbiter and shall receive any appeals against the decisions of the Returning Officer.

vi.    Add 11.4
The finances of the Society shall be maintained in accordance with the C&S Handbook for Treasurers produced by the Clubs & Societies Office of The University of the Sydney Union, and submitted for audit by the Clubs & Societies Auditor immediately following the Financial Year End of the Society in the month of April each year.

vii.   Add 11.5
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Constitution, all assets and funds of the Society shall be used solely to further the Objects of the Society, and no portion of those funds shall be paid or distributed to members of the Society except as compensation for out-of-pocket expenses.
 
viii.   Add 11.6
The financial year of the Society shall run from the 1st of April to the 31st of March following.
 
ix.    Amend 12.2 to read
The Secretary shall give at least fourteen (14) clear days notice of the time and place of such a General Meeting through one of the recognized publications of the University of Sydney Union and, if possible, the Society notice board and, if possible, by a mail-out to all members. (A mail-out is understood to include communication by-mail.)

7.	ANNUAL REPORTS 
7.1 President 
7.2 Treasurer

8.	ELECTION OF THE EXECUTIVES 
i.	President 
ii.	Vice-President
iii.	Secretary
iv.	Treasurer
v.	Publicity Officer
vi.	Events Officer
vii.	IT/Graphics Officer
viii.	Sponsorship Officer
ix.	3 x General Executive

9.	GENERAL BUSINESS

10.	OTHER BUSINESS

11.	DATE OF THE NEXT MEETING

12.	CLOSE OF MEETING

event_name: SHADES Movie Night: Pride for Pride!
description:
What better to celebrate Pride Week than snuggling up with your buds and watching last year's hit Pride?

Come along on Wednesday night for all the feels, plus pizza and popcorn! (And tissues for the emotional ones among us :P)

We'll be with pizza at 6, with the movie starting at 7!

Pricing:
Access - FREE
Non-Access - $6

To celebrate Pride Week we are having a FREE BBQ!

Not much more to say come to the Squash Courts Roof BBQ near Manning Building from 12 until 1, munch on some delicious sausage or vege burger and spread all the goss from the party ;) 

(BBQ is on the left as you head down from Eastern Ave to Manning Bar)

Pricing:
Access: FREE
Non-Acess: $6

Uni is back and the world as we know it is ending! 

Are you ready to enter a dark world of moaning, groaning, lip-biting, tossled hair, and clothing that is ripped in all the right places? Well then, bring your sexy self to the SHADES Apocalypse party to celebrate the darkest event of the year: the start of semester. On the 20th of March while the world is crumbling around us we’ll keep on dancing till the world ends upstairs at Qbar from 10pm, so come get down and dirty on that d-floor with zombies, rangers, and anything else you can dream up! *snaps for those who got the Britney reference ;)*

As usual entry is just $10 on the door some things never change!

Are you ready for an unreal experience with the undead? We thought so.

Lectures might suck but free lunch sure doesn't! Come join us at Courtyard Restaurant and Bar in Holme for FREE pizza!

Just started uni? Wanna make some cool queer friends? Come along and meet some new people and mingle or for the veteran shadesters reconnect with old friends you've neglected over the break!

*vego and gluten-free options available*

Price:
Members - FREE
Access - $5
Non-Access - $11
street: Holme Building, Science Rd, University of Sydney

description:
Forget your woes and that exam you might have failed because like Cher you can't turn back time! Thats right, we are getting out our leggings and shoulder pads for the SHADES end of semester 80’s party! Go back to the days when George Michael was straight, Whitney was fresh faced and Michael was consuming the charts and not sleeping pills! So why don’t you raid your parents’ closet, dial your pals with your hamburger phone and dance the night away in tacky style at the Imperial Hotel on Saturday the 22nd of November? 

Everyone that misses out is definitely not a heather! 

***PREDRANKS***

We are going to be doing pre-drinks upstairs at the Imperial from 8:30 on the night. Plus there will be a drag show on upstairs at about 9, so come along for some free drinks and meet some more people before we all head down at 10 and cut footloose! x

Tickets are $10 at the door.
The party will be in the Basement bar.

See you all there!

You are cordially invited to attend the second annual queer ball Glitter Gala presented by the USU Queer Coordinators, in partnership with SHADES. 

Glitter Gala brings together our community and celebrates the successes we have made over the past year. It is open to all, so everyone no matter how they identify are welcome to come join in the celebrations.

Come and join us from 7pm in The Refectory for a formal night including a 2-course meal with drinks provided. There will be speeches from various queer representatives throughout the night and a DJ to get the dance floor going once the dinner is over. 

The official after party hosted by SHADES will keep the celebrations going once the Gala finishes.

Dress code: Formal & Fabulous

Price: $40 for Access card holders, $50 for general admission.

ALL TICKETS ARE NOW SOLD OUT

There will be 10 people per table, if you wish to organise your own table please contact us at queerconvenors@usu.edu.au

Please email any specific dietary requirements to queerconvenors@usu.edu.au

If you would like to attend but require equity assistance we encourage you to contact us as soon as possible at queerconvenors@usu.edu.au this will be kept strictly confidential.
street: Holme Building, Science Road, Univerisity of Sydney NSW

description:
Ever wanted to work the runway like a RuPaul glamazon? SHADES is giving you the chance at this year's Verge Arts Festival. Come learn all the tricks, fix ups and tuck ups in Studio B; where you get the chance to learn under one of Oxford Street's finest, Karen Kardashian! Star of The Stonewall Hotel's Goddess show and one of ARQ Sydney's Tworking Girls, Karen will be the host of a Drag Workshop that will teach you how to paint a flawless face and put a bit of bass in your walk.

We will provide the make-up to get you on the way. However if you have any make-up of your own bring it along! And remember to bring your own lashes!

This event is open to everyone, so anyone can learn to be flawless!

This workshop has room for 20 people, so RSVP BY THURSDAY THE 9TH to president@shades.org.au ASAP to get a spot! 

Pricing
$10 Access
$20 Non-Access

For more Verge Festival events, click here: http://on.fb.me/1swCqKa

event_name: SHADES Presents: Radical Sex & Consent Day Party
description:
The University of Sydney Union and SHADES proudly present the Radical Sex and Consent Day Party! Celebrate the end of Radical Sex and Consent Day with a bang, burlesque and beats. Headlining the evening, fresh from her gigs at Glastonbury and Edinburgh Fringe, will be the obscene beauty queen, Betty Grumble, and the prolific and playful rapper/producer Simo Soo. 

Also performing will be regular SHADES drag queens, Fran Giapanni, Toxique Haze and Barbra Blacksheep. Spinning until well into the night will be SHADES DJ favourites Floozy and Damsel, as well as Ruby Slippers (GirlThing, Birdcage), Mikey Carr (Freda's), and our very own Wyldstyle (SHADES, The ACCESS Desk).

Free entry, with a free drink for the first 50 ACCESS card holders through the door. Get ready to party from 7:30pm till late!

WARNING: some performances at this event may involve explicit imagery. Strictly 18+, ID will be checked at the door.
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

description:
This year the Sydney University Queer Revue Society (SUQRS) are putting on the sure to be fabulous 'The Nightmare Before Mardi Gras' show! 

SHADES is proud to be a primary sponsor of the production and as part of that we are giving out 20 FREE tickets to SHADES members for the opening night of the show, Wednesday 27th August!

If you are a SHADES member and want a free ticket all you have to do is email your name (as it appears on your Access Card) and your Access card number to president@shades.org.au

We will be holding pre drinks beforehand at Hermann's from 5 so come along and grab a few drinks on SHADES before we all will head over to the Seymour for the show.

Tickets will be allocated on a  first in first serve basis, so be quick to ensure you secure a ticket!

Link to the shows event is here: https://www.facebook.com/events/523075637821252/
street: University of Sydney, Cnr City Rd & Butlin Ave Butlin Ave

event_name: SHADES does trivia for a Queer cause!
description:
Fancy yourself brighter than the average bulb? Or just want to get drunk with your friends and have a good laugh? Well, why not embarrass yourself at a trivia night!

Teams will be organised at the door, so if you rock up as a lone wolf that is no problem — just bring your beautiful self along at 5pm let us do the rest. This event is held in honour of the upcoming Queer Revue, which will be showing from the 27th-30th of August. 

Free for SHADES members/ $5 for access members/ 10 for non-access members.

See you all there!
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

description:
Got the post-holiday blues? Well shimmy into semester in style with us at the 'SHADES back to school' party at the Underground Bar in the Oxford Hotel! Trade in your usual student-chic outfit for that high school uniform we know you never threw out. The proceeds of this event will go to  Queer Revue's upcoming "The Nightmare Before Mardi Gras", so be sure to bring your friends! 

As always it's $10 on the door and a guaranteed good time!

For those who cannot wait until ten to have a good time, join us at Kinselas from 8:30pm for some pre-drinks on SHADES. See you all there!

Forget your lunch next Tuesday and come join the us for a pre-party, Pride Festival barbecue! Catch up with old friends or meet new ones while enjoying sausages,  vegetarian burgers and a drink, courtesy of SHADES. 

$2 for Shades members, $4 for Access card holders, and $6 for non-Access.

See ya there!

Ruffle those feathers, don that mask, and come join us for a wild night at the Phoenix Bar! Sweat away the stress of the semester in style, as the SHADES carnival party is sure to be a night you won't forget! So pull out wildest and sexiest costume you can find (come on, we know you all have them), and get your sweet self over to the Exchange Hotel at 10:00pm. Entry is $10 on the door.

See you all there! Free drinks for the best dressed!


**And just a friendly reminder, SHADES has a zero tolerance policy towards sexual harassment. Any breach of this and the executive will act accordingly.**

Hey Shadsters! A very sad day is coming and soon, your beloved executive will be saying goodbye.

On a more positive note, it is now your chance to take part in the SHADES election, whether nominating to be one of the new and fresh executive, or turning up to vote for those you want to become overlords of this magnificent society!

Held on the 19th of May at 7:00, the AGM will be used to both elect a new executive and to pass constitutional changes as required by the USU.

The Constitutional Changes are as follows:

     Add 2.1
“The Society” is not for profit; meaning: the assets and income of the society shall be applied solely in furtherance of the aims of the society and no portion shall be distributed directly or indirectly to the members of the society except as bona fide compensation expenses incurred on behalf of the society.

     Amend 7.3 to read
Except as provided in Clause 9, the Secretary shall give at least seven (7) clear days notice of the time and place of a General Meeting through one of the recognized publications of the University of Sydney Union and, if possible, the Society notice board and, if possible, by a mail-out to all members. (A mail-out is understood to include communication by e-mail.)

     Amend 7.4 to read
Quorum at General Meetings shall be the lesser of one-third of the Ordinary Members or fifteen (15) Ordinary Members. If within thirty minutes from the time appointed for the meeting a quorum is not present, the meeting shall be dissolved.

     Amend 8.3 to read
The Secretary shall give at least fourteen (14) clear days notice of the time and place of the Annual General Meeting in one of the recognised publications of the University of Sydney Union and, if possible, the Society notice board and, if possible, by a mail-out to all members. (A mail-out is understood to include communication by e-mail.)

     Amend 9.4 to read
The Secretary shall give at least fourteen (14) clear days notice of the time and place of the annual elections in one of the recognised publications of the University of Sydney Union and, if possible, the Society notice board and, if possible, by a mailout to all members. (A mail-out is understood to include communication by email.) The notice shall state:
     i) the day on which nominations open, which day shall be at least fourteen (14) clear days before the day of the elections;
     ii) the day and time on which nominations close, which shall be no later than the time of the meeting at which the elections are to occur;
     iii) the time, date and venue of the election;
     iv) that only Ordinary Members, and Honorary Members who would otherwise be eligible for Ordinary Membership, shall be eligible to be candidates for election or to vote.

     Amend 9.7 to read
The Clubs and Societies Manager shall serve as Electoral Arbiter and shall receive any appeals against the decisions of the Returning Officer.

     Add 11.4
The finances of the Society shall be maintained in accordance with the C&S Handbook for Treasurers produced by the Clubs & Societies Office of The University of the Sydney Union, and submitted for audit by the Clubs & Societies Auditor immediately following the Financial Year End of the Society in the month of April each year.

     Add 11.5
Notwithstanding anything contained in this Constitution, all assets and funds of the Society shall be used solely to further the Objects of the Society, and no portion of those funds shall be paid or distributed to members of the Society except as compensation for out-of-pocket expenses.

     Add 11.6
The financial year of the Society shall run from the 1st of April to the 31st of March following.

     Amend 12.2 to read
The Secretary shall give at least fourteen (14) clear days notice of the time and place of such a General Meeting through one of the recognized publications of the University of Sydney Union and, if possible, the Society notice board and, if possible, by a mail-out to all members. (A mail-out is understood to include communication by-mail.)


Election will be held for the positions of:
     i) a President
     ii) A Vice President
     iii) A Secretary
     iv) A Treasurer
     v) An Activities Officer
     vi) A Publicity Officer
     vii) An IT/Graphics Officer
     viii) A Sponsorship Officer
     ix) Up to 3 other executive members.

Nominations can be made for multiple positions. All nominations must be sent to:
          secretary@shades.org.au
Nominations can be made from now and will close 24 hours before the start of the AGM.


SHADES will also be holding an informal information session for anyone interested in running for a position. This will take place at 6:00 on the 12th of May at Manning Bar. Drinks will be provided and this will also be the last opportunity to become a member before the AGM.

Only Ordinary and Honourable members can nominate or vote at the elections.

Hope to see you all there!!!

What do High Court battles, high quality journalism and Wear it Purple have in common?

…

No, seriously, that wasn't rhetorical. We're struggling for an intro here.

But ignoring our introduction, SHADES, with the help of the SULS queer portfolio, has the delight of hosting a speaker night, in which Norrie May-Welby, Julie McCrossin and Jayde Ellis will get to revel in their success and show that sexuality should never be a barrier.

Speaking from very different backgrounds, all of our guests have pursued their goals and fought for LGBTQI rights, improving the world around them and winning them many admirers and fans. To talk about their pasts, and what they are looking forward to, join us on the 7th of May and you won't be disappointed.

Light refreshments and drinks will be provided.
Free for SHADES members / $5 Access / $15 non-Access.

You can become a shades member on the night for $6.

Please note: this event is all ages, however if you plan on drinking alcohol, please bring ID!
place: Law Faculty Common Room, Level 4, New Law Building

description:
****NOW WITH ADDED MEAN GIRLS****

Coming up this Wednesday, SHADES is hosting (with the help of local drag queen Barbra Blacksheep!) Trivia in Manning Bar and we hope to see you all there. Starting at 5:00, the event is completely free and if you're a SHADES member, you get a drink and fries on us. (If you have an access card, you can become a member on the day for $6).

Prizes are to be had, drinks are to be drunk, and questions are to be answered. Will you prove your knowledge of all things MEAN GIRLS?

TEAMS: Teams can range anywhere from 4-8 people. Send through your team list to secretary@shades.org.au anytime before 5pm Wednesday. Don't worry if you don't know anyone else coming, we'll find a team for you also! Just flick us an email or come along on the night and we'll get you sorted.
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

event_name: TODAY!!!! SHADES Talks Oral Sex for Health and Wellbeing Week
description:
Health and Wellbeing Week is an important week in the USU calendar and what better way to celebrate than to talk all things oral sex. Or at least that's what we thought here at SHADES.

On Wednesday 9th April, from 2-3:00pm, SHADES will be hosting a talk on how to stay healthy during all kinds of oral sex in which facilitators will come in to speak followed by a Q and A as well as an informal discussion. Held in the Queer Space, this event will be autonomous for queer and questioning students.

With free entry and snacks provided, this event will complement other workshops being held by QuAC later in semester. We hope that both queer and questioning students will feel more than welcome.

event_name: SHADES takes over DENDY CINEMAS for ROCKY HORROR!!
description:
On Monday 31st March, we'll be taking over one of Dendy's cinemas to screen a film of our own choice exclusively. We'll be screening The Rocky Horror Picture Show, so costumes, singing, and dancing ARE MOST WELCOME!

You can recline in the comfy chairs, surrounded by your closest SHADES buddies, and relax, knowing that if you want to laugh, cry, or shout at the screen, there'll be no annoyed stranger to glower at you! 

We'll be meeting at 5:30 pm in Camperdown Memorial Rest Park, where you can BYO some booze to ease you into the movie (and the week) or just hang out and chat. We'll then be heading over to Dendy as a group, where our cinema awaits.

Entry is just $4 for SHADES members, $8 for Access card holders and $14 for non-access card holders. Entry fee gets you a seat in the cinema as well as snacks!

As places are strictly limited, please email secretary@shades.org.au to book a spot! You may email on behalf of a group of people, we just ask that you provide the names and access card details of everyone you email.

If you are not a member of SHADES but would like to be, let our secretary Luca know in your email. Then, on Monday, we will collect your membership fee and your cinema entry fee.

event_name: SHADES START OF SEMESTER PARTY: Mobsters Vs Lobsters!
description:
Ever wondered who would in a win between a lobster and and a mobster? Would the mobster eat the lobster? Or would the lobster overpower the mobster and drag them into the mysterious depths of the ocean?

SHADES has.

Our start of semester party is dedicated to discovering which group is the strongest: the suits or the shells. Pick your side, and we'll see you on the dancefloor for an epic battle, grooving to the beats of Dj loulou (of Snapback fame), and SHADES fave Floozy!!

SHADES START OF SEMESTER PARTY
10pm, Friday 14th March
The Imperial Hotel (in the basement)
$10 on the door
Everyone welcome

*** Pre-drinks to start at 9pm at the upstairs bar area ***

****NB: THE ONLY FIGHTING SHADES ACTUALLY CONDONES IS DANCE-FIGHTING. ANY MOBSTERS AND LOBSTERS ATTEMPTING TO PHYSICALLY HARM EACH OTHER WILL BE THROWN OUT****

On Thursday of Week 1, we'll be welcoming all our new (and old) members with a good old fashioned picnic!

Join us on the front lawns for some rainbow cupcakes, snacks, games and music. All welcome!

Free for access, $6 non-access. Snacks and drinks provided.

O Week is here again.
Don't forget to come sign up at the stall, and pick up some exciting new merch and a member bag!

THE STALL: We're on the front lawns again this year, not too far from the Queer revue, so don't forget to come say hello. 
Membership is $6, and new members will receive a goody bag AND a drink voucher for our first party. We'll also be selling our signature gold glitter tshirts, plus a very limited run of our special rainbow edition shirts, as well as some brand new SEXY SINGLETS for dirt cheap!

THE MEET AND GREET: On Wednesday the 26th, from 2-4pm, we'll be in Manning to welcome all our new members and the newest queers on campus. 
FREE for ACCESS, $6 non-ACCESS, and the drinks and fries are on us. There'll also be a very special performance from the Queer Revue, so don't miss it.

QUEERS OF THE JUNGLE: On Thursday 27th Feb, from 12-1, we'll be in Hermann's for queers of the jungle! You can find out more info about us and all the other queer groups on campus, as well as socialise, grab a few drinks and some food, and listen to tunes spun by resident SHADES DJ Himn! more info for that is here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1412158922365913/?fref=ts


SEE YOU AT O WEEK!
street: Manning House, Manning Rd, University of Sydney

description:
If you thought the SHADES year ended when semester did.... YOU WERE WRONG!

On Friday, 20th December, we're having our 3rd annual Christmas party, at our old favourite, The Sly Fox. 

Entry is by donation, with all proceeds going to The Gender Centre in Petersham. For more information on them, see here: http://www.gendercentre.org.au/

Recommended donation is $5-10. Every donation of $10 or more gets a free drink!

So dig up your Santa hats, reindeer ears and tinsel, and get into the SHADES Christmas spirit!

Hey Shadesters,

We're coming up to the end of the year and thought you might need a break. Luckily for you, SHADES is holding it's end of year party a bit earlier this year and so take a break from exam prep and party with us at the Burdekin on Friday, the 15th of November.

And what better way to end the year then to get back to your ABCs! This is an alphabet party so get dressed up using the first letter of your name. Whether you are President Pedro, Laundry Louise or Sarah, the Seriously Swell Singing Santa, all are welcome for our event to end an era.

This Dr. Seuss book is kicking off with pre-drinks at 9:00 in the downstairs bar before moving up at 10:00 to the party.

As usual, $10 for entry and a guaranteed good time!

Please note: Burdekin requires that all patrons are clothed. Anyone without pants, a shirt or shoes will not be let in.

Following the success of the last SHADES trivia night, we're holding another! We'll have some great rounds of questions on a wide variety of topics (you don't need to be schooled in queer theory, don't worry) with some fun games like 'Tops and Bottoms' in between.

There will be pizza and jugs on offer, as well as some fabulous SHADES-related prizes. Hosts and possible special guest TBC. 

This event will cost $5 for ACCESS card holders and $10 for everybody else. 

Please email Luca at secretary@shades.org.au with your tables of 6-8 people. If you're flying solo or are a group of less than 6, email Luca and he'll pair you up with some friendly people. 

Hope to see you there!
street: University of Sydney, Cnr City Rd & Butlin Ave Butlin Ave

description:
Hey shadesters,

It's time to suit up, assemble your own team of avengers and work on your superhero origin stories as Super Queeroes around the university unite for some classic SHADES fun! 

We will be having pre-drinks from 8.30 on the rooftop bar for ANYONE who is new to shades and wants to make a few friends to enjoy the party with - everyone is welcome to come and chat to our exec and extra eager partygoers! 

As usual $10 for entry and a guaranteed good time!

Please note: Zanzibar requires that all patrons are clothed. Anyone without pants, a shirt or shoes will not be let in.

Hello Shadsters,

Want to go to Queer Revue? Well if your answer was a massive "HELL YES!" then you should buy your ticket quickly before they all run out.

SHADES has run out of our $5 dollar tickets but if you still want to go, you can buy them at the stalls on eastern avenue between 12:00-2:00 next week or get them online here:

http://www.seymourcentre.com/events/event/peter-pansexual/

What do I do after that? Well, Shades will all be meeting up at 6:30 on Wed, the 11th of Sep, for some pre-drinks before heading off to the Seymour centre for a fun and energetic performance.

For further information on the Queer Revue, go to:
https://www.facebook.com/events/195657820609713/

p.s. Pre-drinks is for EVERYONE who wants to come, not just those attending Queer Revue.

Price (for pre-drinks):
Access - FREE; Non-Access - $6

This event is provided by the USU.
place: Herman's Bar (followed by the Seymour Centre)

event_name: SHADES BBQ: Prep for Wear it Purple
description:
Hey Shadesters!

Wear it Purple Day is coming up and we would love you to join us as we bring back the BBQ to prepare for the day. With 'Wear it Purple' on Friday, we thought a Thursday BBQ would be just the thing to get you in the mood and remind you of what is to come.

Following our Bridesmaids Movie night on Monday and our Wednesday general meeting, we hope that you will join us as we share a sausage sizzle between 12-2:00 at the Manning lawns (where Vegesoc always have their lunches).

Also, we will have information on what Wear it Purple is all about, as well as selling tickets to Queer Revue's upcoming performance: Peter Pansexual! Hope to see you all there!

Pricing (for the BBQ)
Access - FREE
non-Access - $4

(and of course we will have vegetarian options as always!)

UPDATE:

The BBQ has been moved to the Manning lawns (where Vegesoc usually host their events).

Obviously hosting in the same place as the EU host their BBQs was too ironic for the venue booking to handle).

Hello Shadesters! 

Notice is here by given for a General Meeting of the University of Sydney SHADES Society. At this meeting we will be holding elections for the position of General Executive. 

The agenda will be as follows:

1.	Opening and welcome
2.	Apologies and leaves of absence
3.	Minutes of the previous meeting
4.	Business arising of from the minutes
5.	Motions on notice
6.	General business
a.	Election of Office Bearers
i. General Executive
7.	Other Business
8.	Date of the next meeting
9.	Close of meeting

If you wish to nominate, please email your nomination, including name and access card number to secretary@shades.org.au before 6pm on Tuesday the 27th of August. No nominations will be received from the floor at this meeting.

We need 15 members to come along so we can make quorum, so if you're free we'd love it for you to come along.

It's time for another SHADES Movie Night— this time we're watching Bridesmaids! 

Head to the Holme Courtyard from 6pm on Monday 26th August to eat pizza and hang with the SHADES crew. 

We'll move into the Holme Student Lounge at 7pm to start the movie. On top of pizza, we’ll be providing you SHADESters with snacks galore to increase your movie watching experience.

This event is FREE for members of Shades, $2 for access card holders and $8 for non-access.

Hope to see you there!
place: Holme Student Lounge, Holme Building, University of Sydney

description:
To kick off Semester 2 and raise money for the Sydney University Queer Revue, SHADES will be holding a Winter Wonderland themed party and drag extravaganza at the Imperial Hotel!

We want to see you in your warmest winter gear. Drag out the daggy '80s ski jackets from your parent's closet, get on your knitted snowflake jumpers, or maybe rock a beanie with a pom pom. 

We're kicking off at 9pm this time around to make sure everybody has time for a drink and a dance before our performances start at 11:30pm. We'll see some performances from our talented Queer Revue cast members, and welcome a special drag guest just past midnight!

There'll be plenty of time for dancing in between acts, so don't fret— there is plenty of classic SHADES fun to be had. 

$10 on the door, with profits going to the Sydney University Queer Revue. 

Hope to see you there!
place: The Imperial Hotel, 35 Erskineville Rd Erskineville NSW 2043

description:
Hey Shadesters!

Welcome back all to semester 2! We have many great parties and events planned for this semester and to kick it off we're having a BBQ completely on us!

So come on down to the Manning Squash Courts Rooftop BBQ area between 12-2. Meet up and chill with all those friends you haven't seen since last semester and meet some lovely new faces while you're at it as well. We'll have mats to sit on and encourage everyone to stick around for a chat!


Pricing

Access - FREE
non-Access - $4

(and of course we will have vegetarian options as always!)
place: Manning Squash Courts Rooftop BBQ Area

description:
Hi everyone!

O week is just around the corner (27 Feb - 1 March) and it's a great opportunity for you to see what the Clubs and Societies of Usyd have to offer! SciSoc will have it's own stall right outside The Carslaw Building on Eastern Avenue.

You can join Scisoc and buy one of our T-Shirts which gives you free food if you come to any of our fortnightly BBQ's throughout the year (and shows off your science pride!). T-Shirt costs are:
$10 Access
$15 Non- Access

You can sign up for First Year camp! A great way to make new friends in your area of study. There are less than 100 spots and they fill up really fast. so if you want to ensure you're place, visit the stall early on the morning (9am stall opens) of Wednesday 27 Feb with your completed form and your cash. Costs are:
$90 Access
$100 Non-Access
Camp form can be found here: http://scisoc.org.au/2013-first-year-camp-registration-form/

Did you know that this year SciSoc is being sponsored by Popular Science? As a result you can pick up a copy of the latest issue of their awesome magazine at the stall. And it's completely free!
 
See you there!
We'll also have some showbags with some giveaways and goodies inside! Who doesn't like free stuff?

So come and pay us a visit! see you there :-) Have fun at O Week!
place: SciSoc Stall, Eastern Avenue (outside the Carslaw Building)

event_name: Pitch Perfect: A Real Consulting Engagement
description:
Have you ever wanted to learn what a consultant actually does on the day-to-day ? Would you like to know how to earn money from the notes that you spent hours putting together? Then we will see you at our Consultancy Workshop run by EY Senior Consultant Joel Markoff, who is also now working as a General Manager of an exciting startup - Nexus Notes.
 
Date: 26th of October
Time: 1 - 3 pm
Location: ABS2100
 
REGISTER HERE:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfMQA0THdev5agdY41LBJYdD_p3Qb15Gy63h3l3SOxOHbN-ww/viewform?usp=sf_link

Joel knows consulting. After graduating he spent time with Grant Thornton's Recovery and Reorganisation team, and Deloitte's Strategy and Operations team, before beginning his career at EY in Performance and Improvement Advisory. He is one of EY's best internally-rated consultants, with experience in Education, Construction, Financial Services and Healthcare. He is eager to share the process he pursued in one of his engagements, to give us insight into how great consultants work. His advice will be invaluable to students who want to stand out in their applications to work in financial services.
 
He has paused his career at EY to work as General Manager of Nexus Notes, where he oversees a peer-to-peer marketplace used by ~1.5 million University students across Australia and New Zealand to sell and buy summary notes. It's a profitable startup turning over 150k in revenue per year, with 10K users already on the platform internationally. In 2015, it received seed funding through Australia's leading accelerator 'Startmate' which is backed by Blackbird Ventures. Later in 2015 the founders pitched on SharkTank AU. The venture was co-founded at Sydney University and Sydney remains the largest market to date. Students who have put effort into their notes can make easy money and also benefit from mentoring opportunities, job references and access to exclusive events and networking sessions with access to major commercial and legal firms.
 
Joel will be providing unique end to end insight into how a successful project is run at a consulting firm, by breaking down the process and highlighting the various stages of preparing a deliverable. He will also be highlighting how best to take advantage of great opportunities through Nexus Notes. The workshop will be interactive and audience participation is expected! We look forward to seeing you there!

event_name: 180DC Empowering Social Enterprises through Student Consultancy
description:
Ever wanted to make a positive social impact, but weren’t sure about how you could make this change or whether you had the right skills to do so? 180 Degrees Consulting is proud to give you a glimpse into how students can use their skills to help social enterprises and other socially minded not-for-profit organisations, in addition to how you can create social impact through management consultancy. 

We’ll be answering all your questions - from humanitarianism in the consulting sphere, to our clients’ journeys towards lasting social impact, to what we look for in a 180 Degrees consultant. 

We’re hosting a Q&A conversational panel, consisting of a speaker from a past client of ours: Diversional Therapy Australia, alongside several consultants and a 180 Degrees alumnus working at our primary sponsor and leading consulting firm Nous Group. 

Want your question answered? Submit yours below and come along to find out the answer. 
https://tinyurl.com/180dcoweek

This event is great for those who have no idea what 180 Degrees does, as well as those who would like to learn more about how consulting can transform lives for the better.

description:
Do you want to network with top tier consulting firms, learn about innovative business tools and participate in workshops and hackathon challenges while building your consulting skillset? Come along to the 180DC APAC Conference in 2017! 

With super early bird tickets giving you access to 3 days of exclusive conference material, training, and plenty of food for just $25, get in quick before it's too late: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/apac-2017-conference-tickets-31187146595

-Official Conference Details-

Have you loved your work with 180 Degrees or been interested in joining? Do you want to grow your network? Are you interested in the consulting industry and how you can grow yourself? If so, the 180 Degrees APAC Conference is taking place on 24-26 February in Sydney, Australia, and it will help you answer each of these questions.

The APAC 2017 Conference will be a great opportunity to further develop your consulting skills, listen to inspiring speakers, and exchange ideas with other 180 Degrees consultants.

Networking Night

Have you ever thought about what it would be like to work as a consultant? On Friday night, there will be a networking event with representatives from top consulting firms across Sydney. You will be able to hear all about their lives as a consultant and what they do day-to-day and ask them any questions that you may have about what would help you into the role.

Top Consulting Firms

Our day sessions are where the exciting content lies, we have a number of top consulting firms that will deliver training sessions focused around core consulting skills and introduce you to the latest business thinking concepts, such as design and lean thinking, which consultants use every day. Social impact leaders will educate you with a panel on the latest challenges that non-profits and social enterprises are facing, allowing you to increase the quality of your consulting services back at your branches. It will also challenge the way that you approach problems in your own life.

Social Hackathon

There will also be a Hackathon during the conference. You will have the opportunity to work with other 180 Degrees members on a real life problem. An impressive Sydney-based organisation will present a current business issue they are facing, and teams of students will work over the course of the afternoon and then pitch their recommendations to a panel of Consultants and 180 Executives. This is your opportunity to stand out to consulting firms that will be on the judging panel. There will also be some prizes on the line!

Tickets

Tickets are on sale now - book soon because this is an event that you do not want to miss! 

Super early bird prices ($25) are only available until 31 January. 

Further details to come shortly.

description:

Do you have what it takes to apply your consulting skills to solving real-world social business problems? Registrations for the 180 Degrees Consulting and Nous Group Social Impact Consulting Competition are now open! This is an opportunity designed to test your ability to apply business analysis and creativity to solving challenging consulting cases.

To register, please go to our website http://180dc.org/branch/usyd/ 

Registration closes Friday 10th April 


How it will work? 
1. Register your team here by Friday 10 April midday
2. Question 1 will be released on Friday 10th April
3. Send your submissions (slides in PDF form please) to sydney.casecomp@180dc.org by Wednesday 15 April, 5pm
4. After Round 1, the top 3 teams will be selected to continue to Round 2
5. Round 2 question will be released and your team will have 4 days to complete it and present it on Tuesday 21 April at USyd 
6. Round 3 - Grand Final presentation, UNSW
7. Invite your friends (regardless of their university for the Grand Finals) to come and watch
* Round 2 and 3 will be judged by representatives from management consulting firms

Eligibility:
- University of Sydney and UNSW students (please register via the UNSW branch)
- Teams 2-3 people (Email us if you would like us to put you into a group)
- No requirement to be a 180 Degrees member, open to all

This is a fantastic opportunity to gain exposure to real life simulated case written by our primary partner Nous Group, and to network with industry representatives.

Come and join the consultants and clients of the world’s largest student consultancy for a discussion about the charity sector and the opportunities available to students at 180 Degrees. This society helps non-profits and social enterprises to overcome the challenges they’re facing so they can have a greater social impact. The 180 Degrees Wild Ideas Forum will bring together previous consultants and the CEOs of local and global charities to share their insights into social entrepreneurship, charity management and the role 180 Degrees plays in the non-profit space.
 

The panel includes:
· Abarna Raj, manager of Palmera Projects, a not-for-profit organisation that assists vulnerable individuals and groups based in Sri Lanka and Cambodia to develop sustainable livelihoods.

· Thomas Devlin, former President of 180 Degrees Consulting at Sydney University and now a consultant at Bain & Company, one of the world’s most prestigious management consulting firms. Tom is also a member of the research network for the Australian Charities and Not-for-Profits Commission, and he blogs on a range of issues related to economics and charities.

· Annabelle Chauncy, founder of School for Life Foundation, a non-government organisation focused on providing high quality education in rural and disadvantaged areas of Uganda.

· Steve Walz, whose portfolio of non-profit and community causes spans several organisations. Among them are Left Right Think Tank, an independent and non-partisan think-tank of young minds, whose mission is to involve young people in public policy, of which Steve is Chairman and non-Executive Director.
place: The Quadrangle, The University of Sydney

event_name: Halloween Double Feature: Ganja & Hess and Re-Animator
description:
For our final screening of the year, we’re showing a special Halloween themed double feature to wrap up 2017.

Screening first will be Bill Gunn’s 1973 film ‘Ganja & Hess’, an experimental horror take on a vampire tale that sinks deep beneath the skin. After being stabbed by his assistant with an ancient knife, notable anthropologist Dr Hess Green is transformed into an immortal being who is compelled to drink blood. Falling in love with his assistant’s wife, Ganja, he decides to bestow on her the gift of immortality. Named one of the best films of the decade at Cannes in 1973, ‘Ganja & Hess’ is an artistic and bizarre film that is full of symbolic imagery, abstract philosophical concepts and challenging ideas of sex, religion and cultural and racial identity. 

Next up will be Stuart Gordon’s ‘Re-Animator’, a classic of '80s horror which perfectly blends horror and humour to tell the story of a scientist who invents a solution which can bring living tissue back to life. Loosely based on H. P. Lovecraft's episodic novella Herbert West–Reanimator and inspired by Mary Shelley’s Frankenstein, this outrageously gory and comedic film is sure to entertain. 

* * * 

Find us this Wednesday in the Old Geology lecture theatre. We'll be starting a little earlier this week due to the long screening time, so will be screening the first film (Ganja & Hess) at exactly 5 pm. Following the first screening there will be a brief intermission and the second film will be screened at about 7:10. 

We’ll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion. This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

event_name: Filmsoc Week 12: Xiu Xiu: The Sent Down Girl
description:
Our penultimate screening for the year, Xiu Xiu: the Sent Down Girl is a critically acclaimed gem of Chinese cinema. Directed by the legendary Joan Chen, Xiu Xiu follows the struggles of a teenage girl caught in the cultural revolution.

***

Find us this Wednesday in the Old Geology lecture theatre. We'll have pizza from 5, with the screening starting around 5:15. We'll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion. This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

event_name: Filmsoc Week 11: The Night of the Hunter
description:
Described by film critic Roger Ebert as "one of the greatest of all American films", 'The Night of the Hunter' is a noir classic. Following a deranged preacher's attempt to charm money from a lonely widow, 'The Night of the Hunter' is a dark thriller, sure to leave you at the edge of your seat. 

***
Find us this Wednesday in Heydon Laurence 217. We'll have pizza from 5, with the screening starting around 5:15. We'll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion. This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

Directed by legendary auteur David Lynch, Lost Highway is an intense, noir inspired thriller, that combines Lynch's powerful direction with his penchant for the surreal in a fascinating way. Before this weeks screening, we'll be holding our Annual General Meeting, during which 2018's executive team will be elected. Their will be elections for the following roles: President, Vice-President, Treasurer, Secretary, Events Co-ordinator, Sponsorship Officer, and four General Executives. If you cannot attend the AGM in person, in absentia nominations are acceptable. 

***
Find us this Wednesday in The Old Geology Lecture Theatre. We'll have pizza from 5, with the AGM starting around 5:15, and the screening starting from around 5:30. We'll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion. This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

event_name: Filmsoc Week 9: Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
description:
This week we're screening an Aussie classic: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert. Following the adventures of two drag queens and a transgender woman as they travel through the Australian outback, Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, was recieved to critical acclaim, and is sure to delight and amuse all.

***
Find us this Wednesday in The Old Geology Lecture Theatre. We'll have pizza from 5, with the screening starting around 5:15. We'll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion. This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

This week we're showing Errol Morris' classic documentary: 'Gates of Heaven'. Exploring a pet cemetary, and the people who choose to have their companions interred there, 'Gates of Heaven' received critical acclaim, and was proclaimed by Roger Ebert as one of the ten greatest films of all time. 

***
Find us this Wednesday in Heydon Laurence 217. We'll have pizza from 5, with the screening starting around 5:15. We'll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion. This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

event_name: Filmsoc turns 70: The Lady from Shanghai
description:
To celebrate Filmsoc's 70th birthday, this week we're showing a classic from 1947: 'The Lady from Shanghai'. Directed by the legendary Orson Welles (Citizen Kane, Touch of Evil), 'The Lady from Shanghai' is a noir classic. Recieving mixed reviews upon its release, in recent years critical reception has pivoted, and 'The Lady From Shanghai' is now regarded as one of the most iconic and influential films of its era. 

***
Find us this Wednesday in the Old Geology Lecture Theatre. We'll have pizza (and birthday cake) from 5, with the screening starting around 5:15. We'll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion. This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

event_name: Filmsoc Week 6: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari
description:
This week, Filmsoc is showing what is regarded by many as the pinnacle of German expressionism: 'The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari'. Following a twisted hypnotist, and the sleepwalker he has conditioned to murder, 'The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari' is considered to be one of the earliest and most influential horror films, and is sure to leave you thrilled.

***
Find us this Wednesday in Heydon Laurence 217. We'll have pizza from 5, with the screening starting around 5:15. We'll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion. This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

This week we're screening Sean Baker’s entirely iPhone 5s shot film, Tangerine (2015); a comedy that aspires to publicize stories of the trans street culture of Los Angeles in all its harsh and tender reality. The film follows Sin-Dee and Alexandra’s vengeful pursuit of Sin-Dee‘s cheating boyfriend over the short period of Christmas Eve, whilst also exploring the hardships of their lifestyles as trans women who work the streets. A vibrant and hilarious piece, Tangerine was made to amuse and appeal to all audiences, and to ensure that the stories of trans individuals are told.

***
Find us this Wednesday in the Old Geology Lecture Theatre. We'll have pizza from 5, with the screening starting around 5:15. We'll be heading to the Forest Lodge Hotel afterwards for post-film drinks and discussion.
This event is free for members, $5 for Access cardholders. Annual membership is $5 for Access cardholders.

With free entry for all Access card holders, and a free drink voucher for everyone who participates (with many more to be won) Filmsoc trivia is sure to be a night to remember. 

Teams are limited to 8 people, doors will open at 5:45 and the trivia should start a little after 6. Entry is free for Access holders, and just $7 for those without Access.

description:

Following Rocky Balboa (Sylvester Stallone) on his quest to defeat the menacing Soviet boxer, Ivan Drago (USYD alumnus Dolph Lundgren), Rocky IV is a living testament to the cultural and cinematic excess of the 1980's. Rocky IV is sure to enthrall, or at the very least amuse, all viewers. Note: No knowledge of any of the previous films in the Rocky franchise is required to enjoy this film.
